"Triolo is a game of skill for two players. You begin with twelve counters each and take turns to place them around the network of lines on the Triolo board. Maneuver three of your counters into a straight line and you've formed a Triolo. Each time you outwit your opponent and form a Triolo you take one of his counters from the board. Form enough Triolos to remove all his counters and you win the game."

A game for all ages from 8 to 99 years.

30138.name: Disney My Friends Tigger & Pooh
30138.description:
This is a game that was mailed exclusively to Disney Rewards Visa Card members. The game is for preschoolers and is based on the new Playhouse Disney show.
You can be one of four Super Sleuths in the game: Pooh, Tigger, Darby or Buster. On your turn you spin the spinner and advance to that color. You will follow any directions on that square. The player to get around the 21 squares first is the declared the winner and told he solved the mystery.

boardgamecompilation: Zooloretto: Rio Grande Games Expansion Pack #1
30139.description: Three new buildings (the Restaurant, Souvenir Shop and Pavilion) for Zooloretto. The new buildings are available for download and print out from Michael Schacht's Spiele aus Timbuktu website.
30139.name: Zooloretto: Three Additional Buildings

30140.description:
From the Rules:

"General. Khans and Kings (K&K) is the first expansion to the Chevauchee game. Neither game is intended to be a rigorous historical exercise, but more to provide a fun game with some sense of correct period flavor and feel. In this case, K&K adds an “Eastern” (for lack of a more specific term) series of decks, along with a modified “Western” opponent to face them. The Eastern forces are representative of Steppe Warrior armies, most closely modeling Mongols, but also representative of their inheritors as well (Golden Horde, Blue Horde, White Horde, Timurids, Tartars, Cumans, and so forth)."

The game is available free for download at:

http://games.groups.yahoo.com/group/Dubious-designs/
30140.name: Khans and Kings

30141.name: Free Agency
30141.description:
Made by LDS (Latter Day Saints) Game Factory in Placerville, CA. I don't have the instructions, but it looks as though players go around the board -- and off into little side trips like Talents, Leisure, Career, Church. Family and Education -- to gather Blessings but to avoid Trespasses. According to the score sheets, you tally each, plus add the number of side trips made to the Blessing column and it looks like the highest Blessing score wins.

Knowledge cards get you Blessings or Trespasses. Free Agency cards quote verses from LDS scripture. Corner spaces are significant: Go on a Mission or to the Tree of Life; these are the good squares. The bad ones are Temptation and Sin City. It looks like Sin City is like Monopoly's Jail square. You must roll to get out and the longer it takes, the more Trespasses you get.

30142.name: Hestespillet
30142.description:
(Not to be confused with Hestespillet (1996), also by Damm / Egmont.)

Hestespillet (The Horse Game) is a children's racing game, where the players play gallop cards to advance in the course. Players must also play jump cards to overcome the hurdles. There are also some special cards to push or swap the hurdles.

Contents:

Game board
36 move cards
4 pawns with plastic feet
20 hurdles

30143.name: Hjulene på bussen
30143.description:
Hjulene på bussen (The Wheels on the Bus) is a children's game where the players try and get all their pawns on the bus that goes around the game board.

Each turn, the player first throw the die and moves the bus. If the bus gets to a bus stop with pawns on, it stops and the pawns are entering the bus (removed from the game). Then the player throws the die once more and moves one of his or her pawns.

The first player to get all pawns on the bus, wins.

Contents:

16 pawns in four colors
One bus pawn with plastic foot
One die

30144.name: Honningspillet
30144.description:
Honningspillet (The Honey Game) is a Winnie the Pooh-themed children's game.

All playing pieces are mixed before the game starts, and the only way to find out who controls which piece is to move to a bee square and look at the sticker at the bottom of the honey pot. The players must then remember the colors and move their own pots towards the goal.

The first player to get all his or her honey pots to the goal is the winner.

Contents:

Game board
12 honey pot pieces with plastic feet
12 stickers
1 die

30145.name: Hopp med Pippi
30145.description:
Hopp med Pippi (Jump along with Pippi) as a children's game in the theme of Astrid Lindgren's Pippi Longstocking.

The players play Don't touch the floor in Pippi's mansion Villa Villekulla.

Each turn, the players throw the dice with arrows (straight ahead, turn left and turn right), and try to match them with the arrows on the oncoming squares. Then the player throws the special die, and if Pippi is shown, then he or she can move a Pippi token to cover a hole in the floor. If the players fall in a hole, they miss a turn.

Contents:

Game board
One Pippi die
Four dice with arrows
Two Pippi tokens
Four pawns

30146.name: Juliaspillet
30146.description:
Juliaspillet is an activity game where the players get various tasks:

Dilemma: Read a dilemma aloud and guess what your friends would do.
Duel: Read a word backwards, and let the other players guess the word.
Text message: Read the message and move your pawn.

If you answer incorrectly, you are put on the merry-go-round, and cannot move until the pawn there gets to a square with a star.

Contents:

Game board
Five pawns (one to each player and one to the merry-go-round)
One die
One bell
45 dilemma cards
Two answers card
18 duel cards
15 text message cards

30147.name: Juliaspillet: bare for jenter
30147.description:
Juliaspillet - bare for jenter (not to be confused with Juliaspillet (2005) by the same publisher, is a game, where the players must find out who is their secret admirer.

Before starting, each player gets a boy card which they cannot look at. By completing various tasks, the player gets to see one of the other boy cards, and in the end collect enough information to correctly guess the secret admirer. If a player guesses incorrectly, she (or he) loses.

Contents:

Game board
Four pawns
One die
10 boy cards
45 task cards
One result pad

30148.name: Hestespillet
30148.description:
In Hestespillet (The Horse Game), the players control one horse each, and must guide the horse through a show jumping course.

The game has two phases:


Practice (where players pick cards from the table)
Competition (actually two different games, either players playing the whole course at the time, or all players playing simultaneously)


Has an original starting rule, namely "The player who suggested playing Hestespillet starts the game".

30149.name: Herkules: Heltespillet
30149.description:
In Herkules - Heltespillet (Hercules - The Game of Heroes), players try to collect 10 swords and return to the starting square.

Each turn, the player moves both his or her own pawn and the Hades pawn (in any direction). If landing on a hero square, the hero token there is turned over, and the player can lose or gain swords. If Hades reaches a player, they lose half their swords.

Contents:

Game board
Four Hercules pawns with plastic feet
Two dice
38 sword tokens
20 hero tokens
Four Magara pawns
One Hades pawn

30150.name: Pot O' Gold
30150.description:
Based on the NBC Radio game show, the main premise was giving away $1,000 per week by calling a name randomly chosen from the phone book and awarding the money to whoever answered the phone, provided s/he was already tuned in to the broadcast.

So how could this translate to a board game? Well, it attempts to recreate the excitement of waiting at home for the call, containing 12 rotary dial phone disks, a pot filled with "gold" pieces, a dice cup, paper money, and tally sheets.

30151.name: Roodles
30151.description: The Game of Roodles consists of fifty-six cards composed of four series, Wishbone, Horseshoe, Shamrock and Swasticka, each series being number from 1 to 14 consecutively. The object of the game is to get rid of the cards in your hand according to the rules of the game. Roodles could be classified as belonging to the Rummy family of games.

30153.name: IQ på boks
30153.description:
(Translated from the publisher's site in Norwegian)

Anne Lene Johnsen is Norway's IQ-queen! With this playful game she wants to teach YOU some clever tricks. Of course you can get smarter. EVERYBODY can get smarter. We exercise our bodies, so why not our brain?

IQ på boks (IQ in a box) contains:
468 exercises, surprises and questions (312 cards in total)
4 individual gameboards
1 notebook
1 category die
64 chips
4 pens
Rule booklet

With IQ på boks you can romp about in lots of delicious candy for the brain. Whom is the quicker thinker? Whom is the smartest strategist? Whom is the luckiest, and is clever enough to snatch victory in front of the ones who think they are smartest. Here you get to use both your IQ and your logic skills, your memory and creativity, your quick mind and gambling willingness, and not least: Luck. You may also think tactical and do cunning moves along the way to better your situation or hinder the others. It is allowed to be clever!

Gulp down a strengthening drink (Anne Lene's recipe is included!), kick start the little grey ones and go ahead!

Who can play? The game is best suited for a maximum of 4 persons if one plays individually, alternatively one may play with 4 teams. You may also use the game to test yourself or challenge a buddy for some mental work out.

30154.name: Kjendis på boks
30154.description:
(Translated from the publisher's site in Norwegian)

Kjendis på boks (Celebrity in a box) is a completely new and hilarious game in the På boks (in a box) series. The game is based on the TV show "Kjendisjakten" (Celebrity hunt), which has been programmed at TV2 since the summer og 2004. The game has been developed in cooperation with the editorial staff of "Kjendisjakten" (RubiconTV).

People in general have great interest for what Hollywood stars, royalty, artists, jet setters and reality wannabes are up to. Therefore you have, together with your family and friends, the chance to hunt for celebrities around the living room table or in the cottage. Each player get to be "presenter" in turn. The object is to guess whom is hiding at the picture behind the pieces. Questions are picked from nine different categories like; movies, sport, culture, power and music.

The game is suitable for teenagers and adults.

30155.name: My First Lotto
30155.description:
Four different games, two of which are matching games, develop vocabulary, visual, problem-solving and memory skills.

Sturdy tiles are matched to boards that have photographs on one side and drawings on the other. Solitary or group play.

30156.name: Art Lotto
30156.description: The game contains five unique collection boards (each with nine reproduced artworks from the National Gallery's collection) and forty-five picture cards- one match for each image from the collection boards. The backs of each card are identically labeled. The game is played like memory- but the objective is to be the first person to collect all the images from your own collection board.

30158.name: Lotto-Zoo
30158.description:
This game for children Ages 4 and up premiered at Essen 2000.

Equipment: 4 player boards, 10 number small cards, 24 wooden pieces (6 carrots, 6 bones, 6 pieces of cheese, 6 fish)

The boards show animals and the foods that they eat. Players turn up cards and if it matches a place that they have a vacancy, they get to place a piece. The player who can fill up their board first wins.

In addition there is a variant which makes the game more interesting.

This game is reviewed at Spielphase

http://sunsite.informatik.rwth-aachen.de/keirat/txt/L/LottoZ...

where it did receive an impressive 4 out of 6 pips.

30159.name: Eventyrspill
30159.description:
Eventyrspill (Fairy Tale Game) is a Disney themed Memory-like game where players must find six different Disney characters. Players move around the playing piece to turn around cards. If Cruella de Ville is turned over, the player must find one Dalmatian before he or she can win.

Contents:

- Game board
- 4 playing pieces
- 56 Disney cards

30160.name: Wanted: Dead or Alive
30160.description:
From the publisher:

"A complete Wild West gun fighting game! Contains a simple 14 page rulebook, 4 good guys, 4 bad guys and a deck of playing cards; all you need to play the game."

30161.description:
(From the box)

Create your own unique multi-colour caterpillar and race to victory in this exciting game.

Aim of the game: To be the first player to cross the finish line with your caterpillar.

1. Build your multi-colour 6 segment caterpillar.
2. Set up the finish line and decide the starting point of the race.
3. Take it in turns to roll the dice. Move your caterpillar segments (starting from the back) one in front of the other until the coloured segment at the front matches the colour on the dice. Place the head on the front segment.
4. If the colour on the die matches the colour of the front segment of your caterpillar, you miss a go. If this happens you can place a barrier in front of your opponent to slow them down.
5. Your opponent must now move around the barrier in order to reach the finish line.
6. The winning caterpillar is the one to cross the finish line first.
30161.name: Caterpillar Race

30162.name: Running with Bulls
30162.description:
From the instructions:

"Running with Bulls is a fun game which teaches children about, saving, investing, companies, shares, the stock market, general financial knowledge and to read the financial newspaper."

It's a roll and move trivia game with a financial theme. From South Africa.

30163.name: Shrewd
30163.description:
From the Rulebook introduction:

Shrewd is a fast-paced game where deal making, strategy, manipulation of other players, and a little luck, leads to success. the object of Shrewd is to maximize your own wealth, at the expense of your opponents. The player with the most money wins. The player increase their wealth in two ways.
First... by ARBITRAGE, which simply means: "gains made through buying and selling".
Second... by meeting the requirements for winning the monopoly fund, greed fund, shrewd fund or by winning one of the five equity finds.

30164.description:
"The search for fame and glory has lured many MechWarriors to the gladiatorial splendor of the Solaris VII arenas. Legends like Danai Liao-Centrella and Yulri Wolf earned their notoriety by competing and triumphing in the no-holds-barred, ’Mech™-on-’Mech duels of the planet’s combative environment. Will you become the next MechWarrior to reign at Solaris VII?" -WizKids

WizKids has taken the Mech element from Mechwarrior: Age of Destruction and confined it within a small arena. Implementing hex based maps with lots of terrain and a simultaneous heat + damage system, Solaris VII is fast paced and easy to get into. The fighting is divided into four weight classes, each of which you can purchase as an action pack. The Mech's maintain cross game compatibility so you can bring in your existing collection to the Solaris game world. Note, however, that unlike the 'Age of Destruction' series, this are not presented as 'collectible' packs - they are clear plastic, so all the miniatures within each pack are visible when purchasing.

Set Contents

4 assault-class ’Mechs: Battlemaster, Kodiak, Shrike, and the highly sought-after Daishi!
4 gear cards
4 pilot cards
1 exclusive 24" x 24" map that can be added to the maps from other Solaris VII products
Complete Solaris VII rules




Complete Product line includes

Solaris VII Medium-Class Action Pack
Solaris VII Light Action Pack
Solaris VII Heavy Action Pack
Solaris VII Assault Action Pack
30164.name: Mechwarrior Solaris VII

30165.description: The Third Reich's desperate Ardennes offensive of Christmas '44: The Battle of the Bulge.
30165.name: The Last Gamble
boardgamefamily: World War 2: Battle of the Bulge

30166.description:
Publisher's Description

Oh, give me a home where the Jackalopes roam
And the Dudes and the Buckaroos play,
I'll slay and I'll loot, give the monsters the boot,
And the dice are not loaded, no way.

The Good, the Bad, and the Munchkin opens a whole new frontier - the Wild West! Forget dragons and goblins - Jackalopes and Davy Croc have just as much treasure. Those plains may seem wide open, but there's lots of monsters to kill, and lots of stuff to take.

Become a Cowboy with a Twenty-Gallon Hat, or an Indian on a Catamount. Fight Wild Bill Hiccup, the Killer Jalapeno, and a Barber Shop Quartet. Take The Annual Bath for an extra level. Or just pal around with your sidekick the Greenhorn, until you sacrifice him to distract a monster.

The Good, the Bad, and the Munchkin is the next stand-alone game in the award-winning Munchkin line. Steve Jackson (I) and John Kovalic have teamed up again to put puns to paper like no one else can. Head 'em up and move 'em out, and get ready to wander the Grim Roper into somebody else's combat and make him "Rootin' Tootin'" for +10...


Other

Part of the Munchkin series.
boardgameversion: English second edition (with card & rule changes)
30166.name: The Good, the Bad, and the Munchkin
boardgameexpansion: The Good, the Bad, and the Munchkin 2: Beating a Dead Horse
Munchkin Get More Loot! Promotional Postcard
boardgamepodcastepisode: Show #6.5 Session Report: Dungeon Quest and TempleCon 2010

30167.name: Beneath the Waves
30167.description:
Beneath the Waves (BtW) is a board-game but started as a floor-top game played entirely at shows. The game is set in a fictional world around 1870. Each player commands one or more steam punk submarines with the goal to sink the opposing side's submarines or fulfill a certain goal/mission.

In order to control a submarine usefully you have to order the crew to perform all the different tasks necessary to the running of a submarine. Then you have to decide the movement of the submarine, trying to outsmart your opponents move. While executing the movement you have to fire the weapons at the right moment to insure maximum devastation.

The game is played by two or more players. The players belong to one side or the other, Germany or the Confederate States of America (CSA). Each side has one or more submarines, three or four for a normal game.

30168.name: Gameface
30168.description: In Gameface players test their knowledge of famous artists, leaders, villains, scientists, and more from only a picture! If players cannot guess correctly, additional clues will help them figure it out. However, more clues result in fewer points. Gameface includes 200 giant sized cards.

30171.name: Bugs Bunny's Carrot Game
30171.description:
Children's game. Contents: 12 plastic carrots in a bag, 1 spinner, game board.

Players twist a little spinner that moves "spinningly" over the gameboard and when it lands in one of the holes that represents carrot holes the player can "dig up" a carrot. If the spinner lands in one of the three mole hills, the player misses his / her next turn. The player that first wins a certain number of carrots (3 in a 3 or 4 player game, 5 in a 2 player game) wins the game. Ages 5 - 12

30173.name: Posti on kaikkialla
30173.description:
Posti on kaikkialla is a promotive game published by the Finnish postal service - Posti.

Your object is to transfer letters, postal parcels and such to chosen squares on the board representing the map of Finland and its postal zones. Players throw dice to see how long distance and to which direction (straight or diagonal) they can move.

Whoever manages to deliver all his/her shipments first wins the game.

30174.name: Check-o
30174.description:
From the Instruction folder:

"CHECK-O is an exciting new game, designed to entertain every member of the family. Two, three or four people can play."

"Action takes place on a board with traditional checker-squares on it, separated so that red squares touch red squares at diagonal corners and similarly, white squares touch white squares at diagonal corners. Moves by players are made diagonally."

"The object of the game is to capture opponents' men by leap-frogging over them until the checkers of only one player remain."

"It will be noted that there is a big square area in the center of the board. Wings extend in four directions giving the playing area the shape of a cross."

"CHECK-O is a direct descendant of the ancient game of Checkers, devised over 5,000 years ago by the Egyptian Pharoahs (sic), so history tells us."

"When the Roman soldiers conquered Egypt, they took home many souvenirs of their exploits in North Africa. Among these was the game of Checkers. Even in ancient times, moves were made in the same way - diagonally across the board - and each player faced his opponent with twelve men."

"CHECK-O, though similar to Checkers, is faster-moving and gives more opportunity for strategy. This is especially true in CHECK-O DOUBLES when each player must out-plan and out-think three opponents who are coming towards him from three different directions."

30175.name: Stratego: Pirates of the Caribbean at Worlds End
30175.description: Ready yourself for battle as the infamous Black Pearl takes on the Flying Dutchman in this Pirates of the Caribbean™ Edition of Stratego® from Hasbro®, the high seas battle strategy game! On the multi-level battle grid, call out suspected hiding areas and keep track of hits and misses. Take the battle from ship to ship and steal your opponent's flag. Play by the classic Landlubber Rules of add the "Pirate Code" for a high seas adventure like none other! For 2 players, the game includes a gameboard, 30 black pieces, 30 tan pieces, 4 cardboard markers, display tray, label sheet, special powers reference sheet and instructions.

30176.name: Ponny
30176.description: The players take part in an equestrian competition and are trying to gather as many plus points as possible during the competition. A Finnish game meant for "horse crazy" girls.

30177.name: Rakennusurakka
30177.description: The players are building contractors who are making offers for building contracts in auctions. After winning auctions you'll of course have to get as rich as possible by building.

30178.name: Campus tietokilpailupeli
30178.description: Campus takes players to the university world. Players are trying to get a degree and in order to achieve that goal they'll have to answer correctly. There are questions from 18 different areas of science. Players are moving around the campus trying to gain the needed knowledge. Giving right answers is actually as hard as finding the right questions.

30179.description: Together, players build a pyramid of light brown and dark brown wooden blocks. Anticipate your opponent’s moves by playing cubes in their colour... In order to be the winning architect there must be more of your colour on at least 2 faces of the completed pyramid!
30179.name: Inside

30180.name: Leela
30180.description: From the back of the box: Designed by Hindu Sages over two thousand years ago and the precursor to the game "chutes and ladders," Leela is nothing less than the game of life, providing insight into our own consciousness and a key to divine knowledge. One or more can play the game of Leela, using only the book and game board, a die, and a significant object that belongs to the player (such as a ring) to serve as his or her symbol during the game...

30181.name: Kaptein Sabeltann og skatten i Kjuttaviga
30181.description:
Kaptein Sabeltann og skatten i Kjuttaviga (Captain Saber-tooth and the Treasure of Kjuttaviga) is a spin-off from the Norwegian children's show character Kaptein Sabeltann by Terje Formoe.

The players compete to find the treasure of Grusomme Gabriel (Hideous Gabriel) and return it to the Pirate's Cove.

The player must first find Grusomme Gabriel's anchor, and then fight Kaptein Sabeltann with the acquired pirate cards to get to the treasure. But beware! Other players may steal the treasure and get to the Cove first!

Contents:

Game board
Four playing pieces with plastic feet
Two dice
12 Kaptein Sabeltann cards
44 pirate cards
Four red obstacles
One treasure card
Two mountains.

30182.name: Junior True or False
30182.description:
Junior True or False is as the name suggests a children's edition of True or False, and has the following categories: "Nature and Animals", "Said and done", "Long time ago" and "Mixed".

Also includes the special die that gives bonus if the die has correct.

Contents:

Game Board
185 question cards
12 true or false cards
Two topic cards
Six pawns
One special die

30183.name: Jungeldyret
30183.description:
In Jungeldyret (The Jungle Animal), the players play the rare jungle animal Hugo and must get to the jungle as fast as possible, avoiding the evil Izabella and her husband Konrad.

Each turn, the player first moves his or her own pawn, then Izabella's pawn. If Izabella catches the player, then the player misses a turn until they find the Rita card.

Contents:

Game board
Five pawns with plastic feet, including Izabella
Three cards (two Izabella and Konrad cards, and one Rita card)
One die

30184.name: Jul i Skomakergata
30184.description:
Jul i Skomakergata (Christmas at Shoemaker Street) is a spin-off from the most popular advent calendar children's show in Norway.

The players must match all shoe pairs with the correct owner, and at the same time make sure they can feed Tøfflus parsley whenever he appears.

Contents:

Game board
24 shelf cards
18 parsley cards
Four pawns with plastic feet
Four markers
One spinner

30185.name: Chuggedy Chug Game
30185.description:
A simple train game for children in which a player spins a spinner and then moves his train down a track. Special spaces on the track can force the child to blow his whistle or to lose a turn, possible destroying a deeply developed strategy.

The game is significant for its theme. Pictured prominently on the box is the ventriloquist Paul Winchell and two of his wooden dummies. In reality, Winchell and the dummies have nothing to do with the game - their names simply appear on the board. But Winchell was at the height of his popularity when the game was released, so he name and image were used as makerting tools.

On a side not, Paul Winchell also did the voice of Tigger in the Winnie-the-Pooh movies.

30186.name: Das große Stromverbund-Spiel
30186.description:
(copied from instruction sheet:)Jeder Spieler erhält 2 Figuren einer Farbe. Aufgabe ist es, als erster beide Figuren in das Ziel zu bringen. Der jüngste Spieler beginnt. Man rückt so viele Felder vor, wie man Augen gewürfelt hat. Rückwärts ziehen ist nicht erlaubt. Wer eine 6 wirft, darf nochmals würfeln.

Auf jedem Spielfeld darf nur eine Figur stehen. Rauswerfen ist erlaubt. Wer auf ein Feld mit orangefarbener Zahl kommt, hat die entsprechende Anweisung ohne Widerstand zu befolgen. Beide Spielfiguren müssen mit direktem Wurf ins Ziel gebracht werden. Wem dies gelingt ist Sieger.

(English translation from on-line translator and re-worded a bit by me:)Each player receives two pawns of the same color. The challenge is to bring both pawns to the end space. I presume this to be the giant electrical plug at the end of space 80. The youngest player begins. A player advances as many spaces as a roll of the die. No moving backwards. If you roll a six, you may roll again. Only one pawn at a time on each number. Elimination is permitted. If you land on an orange number, you must immediately follow the instructions printed on the side of the board. Whoever gets both his pawns into the end space with exact roll of the die is the winner. Only one pawn at a time on each number. Elimination is permitted.

Examples of orange space instructions:


31 says Gemeinsam duschen nach Fußallspiel spart Energie. 3 Felder vorrücken. On-line translation: Showering together after playing football saves energy. Advance three spaces.



59: Panne legt großes Kraftwerk still. 2 Runden Aussetzen. Trans: Large power station shut-down. Lose two turns.

30187.name: Vex
30187.description:
Equipment consists of eighty-one wooden tiles. The tiles represent three complete alphabets and three wild cards. One player draws three tiles and composes a word that uses those three letters of not more that nine letters. The other player has to guess the word. Guessing the word within six tries scores the guessing player two points. Guessing the word within eleven tries scores the guessing player one point. Stumping the guessing player scores the other player two points. The first team to twelve points wins.

When more than two play, they play as two teams.

Vex was named in the Games Magazine Games 100 of 1998.

30188.description: The gameboard is a thirty-six by thirty-six grid that represents a large body of water. The grid is divided into four quadrants. The players start with a small whale boat that is placed inside an individual’s factory ship. Each player places one’s own factory ship at an individual start space at the edge of one’s own quadrant. One of the whales is placed on one the four spaces in the center of the gameboard. Players, in turn, move their factory ships according to the number indicated on the spinner. If spinner points to a picture of a whale, then the whale moves according the number on its spinner. A player must separate the whale boat from the factory ship when the whale and the factory ship are in the same quadrant. Whale boats have their own spinner and they move slower that do the factory ships. When the whale boat and the whale are on the same space, the whale has been harpooned and the player scores a point for killing the whale. The whale boat must be moved back into the factory boat and another whale is brought into play. The last whale brought into play is white and it is worth two points. The player with the most points is the winner.
30188.name: Harpoon, The Real Whale Hunt Game

30189.name: Galax
30189.description: For two or more players. Description: This is a race between the fastest ships in the galaxy. The goal is to reach the Space City in the middle of the galaxy. The player that first lands his ship there is proclaimed the winner. May the best space pilot win.

30190.name: Raptorjakt
30190.description: For two players. Description: Do you want to be a carnivore or a herbivore? Choose your side and head for the swamps! The players start off on opposite ends-with the task of crossing the swamp first. The herbivores need to look out so that they are not eaten by the carnivores, but the herbivores are more numerous.

30191.name: Demonsvärdets Mästare
30191.description: The Master of the Demonsword is a labyrinth game-here you meet dangers in the form of flying snakes, fire balls and skeletons- you will never know what turns up! DO you carry the sun mirror, the fire ointment or the thunder ball? The right object may save you! Otherwise you'll have to duel. You will need to jump on the right stones and choose the correct way in order to reach the sword first.

30192.name: Camp Runamuck
30192.description: Game includes 4 colored movers, a spinner, 3 step rulers (Baby Step, Grown Up Step, and Giant Step. The object of the game is to find and round up all 7 of the campers of your color group. You use the step rulers to try and land on the spaces occupied by your campers, by exact count. When you do you have capture that particular camper. Get all 7 and win the game.

30193.name: Mimikk
30193.description:
Mimikk (Mimicry) is a game where one player makes faces while the others try to recognize the grimace.

Each turn, a player draws a face card, and the other close their eyes while the first player try and mimic the face on the card (with help from the mirror).

When the player knocks the table, the other players can look at his or her face and try to find the corresponding face on the board.

Contents:

Game board
32 face cards
One mirror
Six pawns

30194.name: Mikke Mus-spillet
30194.description:
Mikke Mus-spillet (The Mickey Mouse game) is a simple children's game where the goal is to be the first to skate through the park. There are various ways to the goal, and by taking shortcuts and avoiding Pluto running in the wrong directions, a player may find a shorter route through the park.

Contents:

Game board
Four pawns
Die

30195.name: Mikke Mus og jakten på B-gjengen
30195.description:
In Mikke Mus og jakten på B-gjengen (Mickey Mouse and the Beagle Boys), the players must find three members of the Beagle Boys and return the stolen money to Uncle Scrooge. Each player gets one finger print card with three finger prints, and must find all thiefs with matching finger prints.

The player must move to houses around Duckburg to find either a Beagle Boy, Super Goofy, Chief O'Hara or the Phantom Blot.

Contents:

Game Board
Five pawns with feet
Two dice
Five finger print cards
15 finger print pieces
24 detective cards
90 gold coins

30196.name: Matte-Kryss
30196.description:
Mattekryss (Math scrabble) is a Scrabble-like game, only with numbers.

Each player always has seven tiles on his stands and try and make computations on the board. Each tile is placed next to two other tiles and must be the result of a computation (addition, subtraction, division or multiplication) of these two tiles. Some squares are pink, and restricts the type of operation to perform.

Contents:

Game board
106 tiles with numbers
Four stands

30197.name: Pharomyd
30197.description:
PHAROMYD is played on a triangular board using 16 four-sided "pyramids" (tetrahedrons) - each side has a different marker colour/symbol on it. Players move pieces with the aim of preventing other players from moving, but can only move pieces with their symbol showing. Each piece can be moved by 3 players - the three sides showing - but players can also convert pieces so that their own symbol shows.

A move consists of rolling a "pyramid" in one of 3 directions, tipping it along an edge onto a new face. There are patterns to form - such as sandwiching a "pyramid" between two other "pyramids" with identical faces showing toward each other.

Any player unable to move on their turn is eliminated and the game ends when only 1 player is left in the game.

30198.name: Bryplay Show Jumping
30198.description:
A simulation of International Show Jumping competitions with a choice of 16 identical horses, jumping over a choice of 16 jumps.

Players choose a course, choose a horse, or horses, and proceed around the course turning over Action Cards to decide the outcome of the round. After 3 rounds, the winner is decided based on how few faults each horse has collected.

30199.name: Bird-Shooting Game
30199.description: Bird-shooting indoor target game with the subtitle "...with Harmless Gun." The contents include nicely drawn, colored and printed cardboard cut-outs of four exotic birds which, with the aid of the attached wooden supports to the rear of each, enable the bird to swivel back when struck by a cork as fired by the toy shot gun. A tabletop action dexterity game.

30200.name: Wu-Pee
30200.description:
The idea of this game is to collect the nine pieces that make up a clown. The game comes with 40 cards, each with a clown on one side of the card, and a portion of a larger clown puzzle piece on the backside. Whoever collects the nine pieces of a larger puzzle first, wins the game.

In Wu-Pee Disney Card Game there are 4 different Disney characters to collect.

Box and cards are significantly smaller than usual card games.

30201.name: Famo: The Historical Card Game
30201.description: The game comes with 45 cards featuring famous people and the items associated with them. The people are Sir Walter Raleigh, Guy Fawkes, Florence Nightingale, Grace Darling, Robert Bruce, Admiral Nelson, Bodicca, Frances Drake, William Tell, James Watts and Dick Turpin. There is a joker and 11 sets of four cards - One a picture of the person and three of associated items. The game is a collecting (quartet) game

30202.name: Paranoia Mandatory Card Game Expansion: Secret Societies
boardgameexpansion: Paranoia Mandatory Bonus Fun! Card Game
boardgamefamily: From RPG books to board games
30202.description:
From the publisher:

If only Alpha Complex was free of all secret societies... except the one you belong to! Fortunately being an elite Troubleshooter agent provides you with some interesting opportunities to fulfill your secret societies' deepest wishes. Succeed in your assignments and you will collect valuable IOU awards to further your advancement in Alpha Complex. Fail - and they'll be scraping you out of the carpet for weeks!

Expands:

Paranoia Mandatory Bonus Fun! Card Game

30204.name: Minions: Darkness & Myth
30204.description:
(from publisher's website:)
How does a Minor Deity get more glory than the Minor Deity living next door? By sending Minions into battle of course!

The funny folks at Cloud Kingdom games bring you a fantasy card game where each player becomes a Minor Deity. The object of the game is to get the most Glory. The trouble is that, ever since that “Atlantis Incident,” deities are no longer allowed to directly affect the material world. The only way to get the glory is to send your adoring Minions out to do battle in your stead.

Each player controls eight amusing minions who are sent out to strive against the minions of your opponents. The battleground is defined and, based on your minions’ attributes, you choose the best “ahem” man for the job. You can then grant your minion a Boon to help him succeed. At this point a combination of daring and luck may bring you the glory. Dice are rolled. Points are tallied. Only one Minion will emerge to shower glory on their master. Will it be you?

This game contains all the cards and components for a two player game and takes about 20 minutes to play, ages 10 and up.

30205.name: Shake
30205.description:
(from publisher's website:)
Roll the dice or pay the price. Shake is the ultimate dice game of risk and reward. It’s a roll of a die and then you make the call. Go for it and Shake – it can make you a big winner or break you and leave you with nothing. Shake is easy to learn and hard to stop. It’ll keep the whole family on the edge of their seat. The question is…..are you going to Shake! Includes 12 Shake dice, Shaker Case, instructions, and score pad.

30206.name: I.Q. Games: World Geography
30206.description:
How well do you know your World Geography?

In this game, one player reads from a list of numbered clues on the back of a card while others try to guess the correct answer. You score five points for guessing after one clue and it declines to one point if all five clues are read. The last clue is a picture of the area in question and various visual clues. Players continue taking turns until all cards have been read. Score is kept on included scorekeeper. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

30207.name: I.Q. Games: Famous Places
30207.description:
How well can you identify these famous places?

In this game, one player reads from a list of numbered clues on the back of a card while others try to guess the correct answer. You score five points for guessing after one clue and it declines to one point if all five clues are read. The last clue is a picture of the place in question and various visual clues. Players continue taking turns until all cards have been read. Score is kept on included scorekeeper. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

30208.name: Cranium Ballpark Blast
30208.description:
Made exclusively for Starbucks Coffee stores. Ballpark Blast uses dice and cards to play a three inning baseball based game. Game contains baseball diamond, 4 game movers, 2 dice representing pitch and hit, pencil, and a score pad. There are basic and advanced rules, both easy for a child to learn.

Game play consists of one player rolling the pitching die and another player the hitting die. Based on the outcome the hitter may draw a card which will indicate the base score an out.

30209.name: Danger Zones
30209.description:
Danger Zones is a board game intended to teach children about safety. Players roll the dice and move on a board to various colored spaces and attempt to answer corresponding questions. The questions are directed at educating and testing children's knowledge on various safety issues such as water safety, strangers, bicycle/vehicle safety, etc. When a player answers correctly, he receives a black velcro piece representing a jail bar that is affixed to the player's card. When the player has accumulated sufficient jail bars to lock up "Wacko Weasel" and "Pud Possum" (pictured on the cards), he wins. A player may also be sent to a "Danger Zone" space which requires the additional answering of a question or other penalizing action.

The game has an interesting feature which allows children to play even when there is not an adult available--a cassette tape which has a voice reading questions and answers than can be used instead of the cards.

30210.name: Dragons
30210.description:
Dragons, "The Family Game of Frenzy," is a family-style card game where up to eight players simultaneously attempt to get rid of their deck by playing their cards to sequentially build "dragons."

This game's core mechanic is a type of simultaneous, speed-based card play similar to that used in solitaire. Players have five card slots in front of them, from which they play cards into the center of the table onto piles which comprise dragons made up of first a tail, then the numbers 1-10, and then a head. When players have played a card from one of their slots, they then quickly replace it with one from their deck. Players may play on any dragon stack in the center, which leads to a great deal of frenzy as players try to monitor their own play stacks, keep an eye on the multiple dragon piles that are constantly growing, and try to avoid allowing other players to gain an advantage in building.

Optional rules introduce complexity in scoring, the color sequencing of dragons, battles between players for simultaneous card play, and two-headed or two-tailed dragons. A notable feature of the game is its giant fold-out play mat which includes markings for card play and card slots.

30211.name: Phractured Phrases
30211.description:
Phractured Phrases is a party game where players try to recognize and correct alterations in famous phrases from famous speakers, literature, film, culture, and history

Players divide into two teams. While a timer runs, one player on a team reads cards with famous phrases that have had words replaced in them. The rest of the team tries to identify the wrong words and correct them. For example, the phrase "Don't fire until you see the SIZE of their THIGHS" would need the corrections of "white" and "eyes."
When time is up, the other team can then score points by correcting any phrases missed during the round. Score is kept on a board with various bonus spaces and other incentives.

30212.name: Jim's LectraMatic Torpedo Attack
30212.description: Maybe the first battery operated game ever produced. Torpedo attack relies upon two "D" sized batteries to power the naval warfare game board. Two opponents maneuver their battleships across the ocean while the opposing player attempts to find and torpedo them. A red light comes on when a hit is successful and a small magnet is placed upon the "damaged" ship. An interesting game that appears to have been produced in the early to mid 1960s.

30213.name: Fission
30213.description: Fission is a game where players attempt to eliminate all of their opponents stones but must have at least one stone left on the board in order to win. Played on a 8x8 grid, players have interlocked groups of 12 stones each. Piece can be moved in an orthogonal or diagonal direction and do not stop until they reach either the edge of the board or hit another stone. If stopped by another stone, the moved stone and all adjacent stones are removed from the board.

30215.name: Out of Time: Pirate Revenge
30215.description: From back of box: "Sail the seas evading history's most feared rouges--like Blackbeard and "Calico" Jack Rackham. Engage in fierce battles, bury treasure and cause mutiny on your opponents' ships. Outwit your enemies to collect the most booty and claim victory. Experience life as a real pirate . . . "

30216.description:
In 1995 Ted Raicer's game, The Great War in Europe, was published in Command Magazine by the XTR Corporation. The game was well received, and shortly afterward, an expansion, The Great War in the Near East, was also released.

The Deluxe edition of The Great War in Europe is more than a consolidation of these two games. The rules have be rewritten to include changes that make the game more realistic and yet quicker and easier to play. It also includes scenarios for each front for each year of the war - allowing games to take from as little as two or three hours up to a full weekend for the full campaign game.

The games comes with three maps (Eastern Front, Western Front and Turkey), and app. 1500 ½ inch counters, THE GREAT WAR IN EUROPE: DELUXE EDITION will update two classic designs in an edition that will provide all the challenges and Great War flavour you've come to expect from the designer of Paths of Glory, Clash of Giants, Reds, and Grand Illusion.

Despite the scale and size of the game it plays quickly because as one person is having their turn on the Eastern Front the other player can be having their turn on the Western Front and this means very little downtime.
30216.name: The Great War in Europe: Deluxe Edition

30217.name: The Millionaire Game
30217.description:
From the rules: America's industrial might and business world have produced large numbers of successful people - people, who, through their creative genius and ability to plan, have amassed vast fortunes.

As you play the Millionaire (TM) game you will find that the same strategies and decision-making skills that created real life economic empires will work for you in your quest to reach that magic level of success - to become a MILLIONAIRE (TM).

Those who have been succesful in real life are not afraid to be bold and decisive. They have let their money work for them rather than hiding dollars in dark corners. Expansion of existing operations and acquiring still futher interests at every opportunity are typical of the economic giants today.

The creators of the MILLIONAIRE (TM) game invite you to the world of risk and big loss - to the world of empire building and fantastic profits as you seek to become today's MILLIONAIRE (TM).

30219.name: Demon Mine
30219.description:
Free print-and-play game where miners face off against giant beetles in a collapsed mine. Play until one side is eliminated.

The files (in html or pdf format) provide you with board and event tiles and rules. You must provide 16 pawns and 2 six-sided dice to play.

30220.name: Ratatouille Remy Kitchen Quake Game
30220.description:
Finally, a game where it's appropriate to say "oh, rats!" It's a thrilling daredevil race around a wacky contraption made out of kitchen utensils. But don't let Chef Skinner spot you! He'll drop his cleaver and set off a wild and funny chain reaction that could knock you flying. Be the first to get your special ingredients into the soup and you win! Fun for family members ages 5 and up.

A themed and physically modified version of "Mousetrap".

30222.name: Lek og lær-spillet
30222.description:
In Lek og lær-spillet (The game of play and learn), the players must clean up all roomes of the large house. The players move around the board, and when entering a room, the player must draw one clean up piece from the pile. If it matches the room, the troll there are removed from the room and given to the cleaning player as a trophy.

The player with the most trolls when all rooms are cleaned up is the winner.

Contents:

Game board
4 pawns
12 clean up pieces
8 troll pieces
One die

30223.name: Lesespill
30223.description:
In Lesespill (Reading game), the players must find the starting letters of each of the depicted objects on the game board. The players start by putting the pawns on the bottom row of the board, and proceeds by finding the correct letter of the next square. The first player to get to the top of the board wins.

Contents:

Game board
4 pawns
29 letters

30225.name: Minotaur Maze
30225.description:
From the back of the box:
Minotaur Maze is a game of speed and strategy where the object of the game is for players to move through the changing maze to the four pits to rescue their maidens from the minotaur and then return to the minotaur maze disc to win the game.

30227.name: Lurifax
30227.description:
Lurifax is a yatzy-like game, where the players can cross out a square after a combination (like straight, house, even numbers etc) is obtained. The player has three throws to get a combination.

The first player to make to four-in-a-rows wins.
Alternative rules: The first player to make a cross or an l-shape wins.

30228.name: Befudiom
30228.description:
From Rachel Mason's 05/27/2007 article in the Gwinnett Daily Post:

"In the game, players try to identify idioms, like “taking candy from a baby” or “kick the bucket,” in one of four ways. Depending on how the die is rolled, players can act a saying out with charades, sketch it on a piece of paper, spell it in a hangman-like game or shout it with spoken clues."

30229.name: Horse Racing Game
30229.description: No information yet known. Basis for game is a picture which was uploaded to the wrong entry on BGG The Horse Racing Game

30230.name: Pirate Regatta
30230.description: For two or more players. Description: Here you will need to sail fast, but also to look out for sharks and reefs. The beacon may also cause you some trouble. You have battleships and sloops at your disposal...you will need to reach the opposite shore first with one of your ships.

30231.description:
The third specialist pack release (and 2nd expansion for goblins) for BattleLore. This Specialist Pack introduces new figures and each unit type has new Specialist and Weapon summary cards that detail the fighting capabilities for these forces on the battlefield. Each pack also adds additional Banners to deploy them within either camp.

The Goblin Marauders pack features 16 figures including the Goblin Band and mounted Hobgoblins - the Hyena Riders and Ostrich Riders, plus 2 new Adventures.

Contents:

16 figures:
1 Goblin Band Leader (also in BattleLore: Goblin Skirmishers Specialist Pack)
3 Goblin Drummers (also in BattleLore: Goblin Skirmishers Specialist Pack)
6 Hobgoblin Hyena Riders
6 Hobgoblin Ostrich Riders

10 banners (5 for each camp)
2×1 Band
2×2 Green Reflex Bow
2×2 Blue Reflex Bow

4-page Rules Booklet, including 2 new adventures
4 Specialist cards (Goblin Band, Goblin Drummers, Goblin Marauders (2))
3 Weapon Summary cards (Bass Drum, Goblin Drum, Reflex Bow)
1 Unit Summary card (Hyena Riders)




Expands:

BattleLore
boardgameversion: Repurposed French edition with English components
30231.name: BattleLore: Goblin Marauders Specialist Pack

30232.description:
The fourth specialist pack release (and 1st expansion for the humans) for BattleLore. This Specialist Pack introduces new figures and each unit type (crossbow, polearm, and spear) has new Specialist and Weapon summary cards that detail the fighting capabilities for these forces on the battlefield. Each pack also adds additional Banners to deploy them within either camp.

The game includes the following four (4) single adventures: Crécy, Cocherel, Patay and Poitiers. Additionally, Agincourt will be revisited as an epic adventure.

Contents:

32 new figures
4 Halberdiers
4 Horn Blowers
8 Spearmen
16 Arbalestiers

14 Banners (7 for each camp)
2×4 Arbalest
2×2 Spear
2×1 Halberd

8-page rules booklet, including Medieval Lore rules
4 new adventures (Crécy, Cocherel, Patay and Poitiers)
A Bonus Revisit to Agincourt in Epic Mode

6 Specialist Cards (Arbalestiers (2 different), Halberdiers, Horn Blowers (2), Spearmen)
4 Weapon Summary Cards (Arbalest, Halberd, Horn, Spear)




Expands:

BattleLore
boardgameversion: Repurposed French edition with English components
30232.name: BattleLore: The Hundred Years' War – Crossbows & Polearms

30233.description:
RISK 2210 AD - ADVANCED TECH COMMANDER DECK (UNOFFICIAL):

In the not too distant future, with the face of the planet having been ravaged and torn apart by decades of hostilities, the world's top minds have been tasked with creating more devious and devastating ways of waging war. The time for diplomacy has long since passed. The time for advanced warmongering is upon us.

COMMAND CARDS:

One of the biggest differences from the classic game is the addition of commanders: land, naval, space, nuclear, and diplomat. These fill a number of roles with the most basic function being to act as an improved army unit, enabling players to roll eight-sided dice rather than the typical six-sided, but perhaps the most important function of the commanders is allowing the purchase and use of cards of various types. The addition of these cards, and in particular the addition of the Advanced Tech command deck, has a huge effect upon the gaming dynamics. With the addition of these cards the board is opened up making no position impregnable and no attack a certainty. With these cards in use, the game is more fluid with gaming positions and strategies needing to be constantly shifted

RULE VARIATIONS:

The Advanced Tech cards are designed for use as command cards alongside the original sets provided with the standard game. No additional commander token has been provided as it is suggested that the Advanced Tech cards be used in place of the Diplomat cards. If preferred, the Advanced Tech cards can be used in conjunction with additional tokens, representative of an additional commander, therefore allowing the use of all five of the original commanders as well.

Expands:


Risk 2210 A.D.
30233.name: Risk 2210 A.D.: Advanced Tech Command Deck

30234.description:
The equipment for Multimatch I is a set of MacMahon's Three-Color Squares. This contains 24 squares representing all ways to divide a square into four equal triangles (with short edges along the square's diagonals) and color the triangles with 3 colors.

Wade E. Philpott sold a cardboard set of squares, including rules for several games and puzzles, beginning in 1966. Kadon distributed it beginning in 1982 and started producing an acrylic version in 1989.

The second edition Kadon rulebook (dated 1991) contains rules for 4 games, plus variants. The first three were originally designed by Philpott, although they have been changed slightly over the years; Closure was not in the original set and was presumably designed by Kate Jones.

The games are:

Multimatch. Players take turns placing tiles on the 5x5 gameboard. Edges must match and the first piece placed on a border of the board determines the color of that border. Last player wins.

Bingo. Players take turns placing tiles on the 5x5 grid, attempting to be the first to create a row of 5.

Outmatched. Players divide the tiles equally (face-down) and then race to assemble their group into a rectangle, with tile edges matching.

Closure. The tiles are assembled into a random (but edge-matching) group. Players take turns "closing" one of the 3 colors by moving as few tiles as possible. Closing a color requires leaving no exposed edges of that color. Moves may not separate any tiles from the group.
30234.name: Multimatch I

30235.name: Frenzy
30235.description:
Frenzy is an abstract game where players represent schools of fish and/or feeding sharks. Played on an 8x8 grid, the school of fish is represented by 32 stones and the sharks by 2 stones. The school fish move like pieces in Chinese checkers and the sharks move like kings in chess, capturing fish in the same fashion. The sharks win if they can eliminate the school, but a shark is also immobilized if at any time there are no adjacent fish. The school wins by immobilizing both sharks.

This can also be played with multiple boards allowing each player to play as the school on one board and the sharks on the other. By adding more boards the game can be expanded to more than two players.

30236.description:
Hexmozaix is a set of 12 hexagonal tiles divided into 6 regions, 3 rhomboid regions at 3 alternating corners, and 3 chevron-shaped regions each enclosing a rhomboid. There is one tile for each possible way of coloring the regions with 3 colors such that each rhombus is a different color and each chevron is a different color (including reflections).

There are numerous puzzles provided with the set, plus two games. The tiles were created by Charles Butler, the games were presumably created or developed by Kate Jones. The games are:

Hexmozaix. Players (2, 3, or 4) take turns choosing face-up tiles until all 12 are distributed, then play one at a time to the table. Players get points for extending paths of the same color with their tile plays.

Color-Trax. Similar to Hexmozaix, except that each player chooses a color before the tiles are divided up (it is strictly a 3-player game), and scores only for that color.

There is an additional set of 18 tiles which can be added to both games, Hexmozaix II.
30236.name: Hexmozaix

30237.description:
Hexmozaix II is a set of 18 tiles similar to those in Hexmozaix, but with different patterning: they have "all different arrangements of of three colors whereby two chevrons on each tile have one color, two diamonds have a second color, and the remaining two regions are the third color."

One can combine these tiles with the Hexmozaix tiles and play either of the games in that set with all 30 (allowing play of the eponymous game by 2, 3, 5, or 6 players), but the set can be used on its own as well for either game (allowing this game to be played by 2, 3, or 6 players).

Expands:

Hexmozaix
30237.name: Hexmozaix II

30238.name: Quick 6
30238.description:
In Quick 6, players participate in 6 simultaneous games of Tic-Tac-Toe, using dice to determine allowed moves.

On your turn, you roll two dice and pick one of the faces rolled for your move - there are 9 faces showing specific squares, one showing all corners, one showing all edge spaces, and one allowing a move in any square. You can move in any of the 6 grids that has the appropriate space open.

When someone achieves 3 in a row in a grid, or a grid is provably a tie, further play there is prohibited. If 3 in a row is made, the player making it scores points for the squares involved (10 for an edge, 25 for a corner, 100 for the center), and opposing players lose points for the squares they occupy.

The game seems mainly intended for 2 players (only 2 sets of dice are provided), but the rules say 3 or 4 can play using 12 grids.

30239.description:
Disambiguation: This game is for the Golden Compass book, the game for the movie is located over here.




Based on the popular fantasy book that is now becoming a movie, Golden Compass is a story of an orphan girl, Lyra. With her dæmon Pantalaimon, Lyra is trying to unravel the secret of lost children. Her travels will take her to the cold north, home of the witches and the armoured bears. From there, she must travel to the another world - and that is the goal of the players in this game. Players must use their cards to gather experience, partake in encounters and make their way to the goal, before other players succeed in the same task.
30239.name: Der Goldene Kompass

30240.name: Wargaming World War Two
30240.description:
From the rear cover of the book:

In this book Stuart Asquith, editor of Practical Wargamer magazine and contributing editor to Military Modelling magazine, provides a comprehensive guide to wargaming the World War Two period.

He begins by outlining the main events of the 1939-1945 conflict, year by year, and moves on to analyse the war by considering separately the three services - land, sea and air. He discusses each in terms of the background information, organisational details, weaponry and equipment of the major combatant nations suggesting appropriate wargaming rules and scenarios.

boardgamehonor: 2008 Japan Boardgame Prize Voters' Selection Nominee
30241.description:
Patrician takes place in the Middle Ages when men were men and wealthy men were inspired to build magnificent towers in order to show off how prosperous they were. As the old saying goes, the taller the tower, the more influential the family.

Players are master builders trying to profit from these vanity-driven families. You build these towers floor by floor, ready to take credit for making them look good. From Mayfair’s description of the game: “You must shrewdly accept the building orders of the patrician families to position yourself in the right place at the right time. Play your cards right, and your name will be famous among the rich and powerful!”

Patrician comes with 149 wooden tower pieces, 55 building cards, 20 prestige tokens, and a double-sided playing board.

The board represents a number of cities, each of which will have 2 towers when the games ends. Players have a hand of 3 cards, each indicating one city. Playing a card allows that player to add a tower piece to the city indicated by the card. Each city will have a specific number of tower pieces. When the specified number of pieces are played to the city, the city is complete. The player with the most pieces in each of the two towers will score points when the city is completed. The player replaces the played card by taking the card from the city where he played a tower piece. As long as the city in uncompleted, a new card is added to the city to replace the one taken by the player.

In addition to indicating a city, cards have one of 4 secondary functions. They can have one or two Portraits from an influential family. They can add a second tower piece to the same city. they can allow the player to move the top piece from one tower in any other city where the player has at least one tower piece, to the top of the other tower in that same city. Finally, a card may allow the player to take a replacement card from any of the cities, not just the one where the player has added a tower piece. All cards played are kept by the player. At the end of the game, additional points are awarded for every complete set of 3 portraits from the influential families.

The game ends when all cities are completed, which will also be when all cards have been played.

The goal of the game is to be the most successful builder, indicated by having the most points.
30241.name: Patrician
boardgameexpansion: Mayfair Games' Limited Edition Promo Expansion Set #9
boardgamepodcastepisode: BGTG 103 - SR & Feedback (Pandemic On the Brink, Caylus Magna Carta, Patrician)

30242.name: Right Wrong: The Joys of Syntax and Lex
30242.description:
Each player places his/her colored marker on the start circle of their game board (there are 4 individual game boards with 50 squares on each). Working in a clockwise direction each player attempts to answer 'right' or 'wrong' when read a sentence from one of 500 question cards. These sentences will have one word in them that is the questionable word and the player should determine if the word was used correctly in the sentence.

Before giving their 'right' or 'wrong' answer pertaining to the validity of the sentence the player will roll the die. If the player gets the meaning of the word correct they move forward the number shown on the die. If incorrect they move backwards the same number. The first player to reach square 50 on their board is the winner.

Ex. - She added LOVAGE to the stew on the stove.
LOVAGE = An herb of the parsley family.
So, if they answered 'right' then they move forward. If they answered 'wrong' then they move backwords. Simple!

30243.name: Tannenberg, 17 Aug. to 14 Sep. 1914: "Railmobile"
30243.description:
"This game simulated the campaign of the German 8th Army in East Prussia, against the invading Russian 1st and 2nd Armies, during the opening weeks of the First World War. The game is designed for 2 players, one player controlling the German forces invovled in the battle and the other player controlling the Russian forces and enables the campaign to be replayed more or less as it happened - or enabled a more skilful, or luckier, Russian commander to do better than von Rennenkamp and the unfortunate Samsonov.

The game comes with ah historical articale, a set of rules, an A4-sized map, an A4-size page of tables, 28 game counters, 28 unit strength counters and a game turn counter.

Each game turn represents 24 hours. Each hexagon represents 13x13 kilometers. Each counters represents 25-35,000 Russian infantry, 20,000 German infantry or about 10,000 cavalry.

30244.name: Tannenberg, 15 July 1410: Downfall of the Teutonic Order
30244.description:
"This game simulates the battle between the army of the Teutonic Order and the Crusader knights from all over Western Europe who joined them, under Hockmeister Ulrich von Jungingen, and the combined armies of the Kingdom of Poland and the Grand Duchy of Lithuania, under Wladislaw II Jagiello and Vytautas "the Great", fought on 15 July 1410 between the villages of Tannenberg and Ludwigsdorf, west of Lake Lubien in Prussia (modern-day north-east Poland). The game system is a simplified version of that used in "Hanba'al: Ambush at the Trebbia", from the spring 2007 issue of battle-market. As well as enabling the battle to be replayed as it happened, the game is designed to explore "what-if?" questions (see "Scenarios", below), such as:

If the Poles and Lithuanians had deployed the other way round (Poles on the right and Lithuanians on the left) might it have significantly affected the battle?
Can a completely different deployment by both armies make a radical difference to the outcome of the battle?
Could a more intelligent use of the Teutonic infantry have made a difference to the outcome of the battle?




The game includes an historical article, rules, A4-sized map, A4-sized page of tables, 71 game counters, 71 strength counters and a game turn counter.

Each game turn represents 20 minutes. Each hexagon represents about 250x250 meters. Each counter represents 1000 cavalry, 2000 infantry or a leader with their personal "banner" of 240 cavalry.

30245.name: Ma'alinti Rangers: Black Hawks Down
30245.description:
"This game simulates the 1993 Battle of Mogadishu (Ma'alinti Rangers - The day of the Rangers - in Somali). The game is designed for solo play, the player controlling the U.S. and U.N. forces involved in the battle, while the game system simulates the Somali defenders."

The game comes with an historical article, rules, an A4-size map of the Mogadishu area, an A4-size page of tables, 70 game counters, game turn marker, and 2 six-sided dice if not the magazine version.

Each game turn represents 15 minutes. Each hexagon represents about 200x200 meters. Each infantry counter represents from 4 Delta Force or Navy SEALS to 8 Rangers. Each vehicle counter represents 2 Humvees, a 5-ton truck, or a helicopter. There are also three counter representing the Rescue Convoy.

30246.description:
San Quentin Kings is a resource management game based on the economic system of an American prison. Be the leader of your own prison gang directing members through a series of fights that gain control of different aspects of the prison economy. Controlling the economy gets players respect and other important advantages. Gain the most respect and you will be crowned the King of San Quentin.

The game is played in 3 rounds or 'years'. Each year the players have a number of different actions to choose from. Acquire prison knives, get commissary, recruit new members; each year as leader of your prison gang you will have to decide how to best use your members to win the most fights. The more fights you win the more prison resources you control. The more resources you control the more respect you will gain. Be careful or your members will end up in solitary confinement or worse, in the grave! Even if you find yourself running the most powerful gang in the San Quentin beware of the final riot. Who knows what treachery the other gangs may be planning... You can be sure they seek your demise. At games end the players are scored based on what they managed to control in the prison. The more aspects of the prison economy your gang controls the more power and respect you gain. The player's gang with the most respect wins!

San Quentin Kings is 3-5 players and runs 90-120 minutes. Ages 14 and up!
30246.name: San Quentin Kings

30247.name: Around the world
30247.description:
"Travel around the world in a fun-packed race, learning about countries, continents and oceans as you play".

A simple roll and move game based on a grid of 55 squares overlaid on a map of the earth. Players move their counters (airplanes) and obey any instructions for the square they land on.

30248.description:
Once again the rooster got into the barn and is fighting of the chickens, who try to climb up the long way back to their nests.

Each player rolls a special die with the numbers 1,2,3 and a picture of the cock.
Rolling a number lets move your chicken up a plastic ramp closer to the top and victory.
By rolling the cock you may move your chicken one space further, or throw down an "egg" from top of the ramp, hoping to knock over the chickens of your opponents.
First chicken who gets to the top of the ramp wins the game.

This is a small version of Chuck-It Chicken!.

Re-implements:

Chuck-It Chicken!
30248.name: Mini Chuck-it Chicken!

30249.name: BUGS! Card Game
30249.description:
From the publisher:

Search for the scorpion. Find the fly! It's a game of fast-moving fun - all you have to do to win the game is be the quickest to find it, flip it and match it! Kids test their memories when they try to pair up matching bugs in this easy-to-learn classic memory game. Each card features beautiful hand-painted artwork by students from the San Francisco School as well as a fun fact about the featured bug, so you can learn as you play. Includes 50 Bug Cards (25 Matching Pairs) and instructions. Ages 4 and up

30250.name: Brain Quest Around the World Game
30250.description:
From the publisher:

Do you know the World? Learning about the world is fun with Brain Quest World Game. Have fun and test your smarts answering questions about the people, geography and history of the world. Players race around the world answering questions about different cities, countries and continents. Children can reference the map (game board) for clues to answer many of their questions. With questions designed by grade level, children from 3rd grade - 7th grade can all play this game together on a level playing field. When they answer a question correctly, they'll earn a token for that continent. The first player to collect a token for each of the seven continents wins the game. Comes with 660 Questions, Map Game Board, Continent Tokens, 4 Pawns, Spinner Card and Game Instructions. For 2 or more players, Ages 8 and up.

30251.description:
From the publisher:

Perfect for preschool kids, Fruit Dominoes is in a child-friendly format and the original artwork is cute, cute, cute. Little ones match the fruit cards together until no more matches can be made. It's fun to play! And remember, a little bit of fruit a day keeps the doctor away! For 2 - 4 players.
30251.name: My First Brain Quest Fruit Dominoes

30252.description:
From the publisher:

How do you keep from spreading your poison oak rash? How do you get an alligator to let go of your friend's foot? Based on the best-selling books and games, this game brings the Worst-Case concept to kids, to amaze and educate a whole new way. Players have Tool Cards, that feature common items like a broom or water bottle. The kids hear a scenario and decide which tool can get them out of it. Tap the alligator on the nose with the broom to release your friend's foot. Use the water bottle to rinse off the plant oil and your poison ivy rash isn't contagious anymore! Just for fun, What's Worse? Cards give kids icky choices. Like, What's Worse: giving your cat a bath by licking it all over OR eating a giant bowl of dog food? Comes with a game board, 50 Tool Cards, 170 Game Cards, six What's Worse Chips, playing pieces and a die. For 2 to 6 players.
30252.name: The Worst-Case Scenario Survival Game: Junior

boardgamehonor: 2007 Vuoden Peli Children's Game of the Year Nominee
2007 Vuoden Peli Children's Game of the Year Winner
30253.description:
From the publisher:

Polly the Porcupine™ is a spinetingling new memory and strategy game for young children. This fun game stimulates and develops memory, while giving children an introduction to simple strategy. Children also enhance their counting and fine motor skills with Polly the Porcupine™.

Polly the Porcupine™ invites you to draw quills or spines out of Polly's back. Roll the die to determine whether you're trying to draw a short or long spine. After everyone draws a spine, all the players count up the notches on their spines to determine who won that draw. The player who drew the shortest or longest spine, depending on the roll of the die gets to collect that spine. The other players have to return their spines, and they'll want to remember where they put them. You never know when you're going to need to draw another short spine. Contents include cute Porcupine, 32 Spines, Die and Instructions. For 2 to 4 players. Ages 4 and up
30253.name: Polly the Porcupine

30254.name: Escape From Madagascar Stick-Ons Game
30254.description:
From the publisher:

How can four city animals get off of an island thousands of miles from home? You can help them! Based on the DreamWorks movie Madagascar, Alex, Marty, Melman, and Gloria have been stranded on Madagascar and they need to gather Colorforms Stick-Ons pieces that spell out the world HELP. Spin the spinner and move your character around the board to collect the pieces to signal a rescue ship. The first zoo animal to collect all four pieces and get to the finish decides where the ship sails to. Beware the Foosa who lurk in the jungle! They can pop up at any time and set you back! Game comes with Game board, Character cards for Marty, Alex, Melman, and Gloria, Colorforms pieces that Stick Like Magic, Spinner, Instructions, and a special bonus Alex window stick-on! Ages 3 and Up.

30255.description:
From the publisher:

Five Little Monkeys Jumping on the Bed is a simple-to-learn game that introduces children to counting and strategy while developing fine motor skills. The object of the game is to get all of your monkeys onto the bed. Sounds easy? Well watch out, your monkeys may jump off the bed at any time. When they do, it's time to start over. Surprise, laughter and fun for kids and their parents. Comes with Game Board, Plastic Bed, 24 Monkeys, 20 Punch Out Tokens, Spinner Card and Game Instructions. For 2 or more players. Ages 3 & up.
30255.name: Five Little Monkeys Jumping on the Bed

30256.name: Katopsi
30256.description:
With intimate knowledge and experience in designing buildings, Konstantinos D. Zois company created, designed and manufactured a new and revolutionary game, named Katopsi!

The game came from the fields of architecture and design. Katopsi is a Greek word which means ‘ground plan’. The game has a very special concept, based on the creation of residence ground plans with cards as well as on the hard competition between the players for the creation of the ‘smartest’ ground plan!

It’s about a really fascinating game with recreational and educational character, a completely different and subversive suggestion in the world of games!

Katopsi becomes the new way of entertainment, attracting thus the most demanding players to participate in a hard ‘battle’ against their opponents. Players are challenged to sharpen their mind and ‘test’ their imagination by ‘building’ their own houses smart!

30257.name: The Great Black Swamp
boardgamepublisher: Junior Achievement Company of Defiance, Ohio
30257.description: 1795 Indian War Game. Be the first to reach Ft. Greenville, sign the Peace Treaty, and return to Ft. Defiance. You might be stopping at Ft. Miamis, Ft. Adams, Ft. Recovery or Ft. Wayne along your journey.

30258.name: Bugged!
30258.description:
In Bugged! You can play one of the four main races that inhabit the galaxy in an attempt to wipe out any opposition. You could be anything from the mutant bugs with their limited intelligence but powerful weapons to the more resourceful but heavily outnumbered human marines.

It is a hex-based wargame that uses cards to add spice to what units can do. It is available free to print & play but the designer states that it has never been play tested and welcomes feedback.

30259.name: Salomo 3000
30259.description:
Salomo 3000 is a Bible trivia game. The name refers not only to the 3000 questions included but also the 3000 proverbs that are said to have come from King Solomon.

The questions are divided in seven categories. The players are first dealt random category cards. They may keep a part of the cards and exchange the rest with other players. The cards then determine the asked questions.

Players collect pearls into their crowns. Two correct answers in a row gives a pearl. However, in the crown category single correct answer is worth a pearl. First one to collect seven pearls wins the game.

Expanded by:

Salomo Junior

30260.name: Murder à la carte: The Champagne Murders
30260.description:
It's the Summer of Love, July 1967, and London still swings like a pendulum do. In the Chelsea home of Lord Michael Jagged, a select group of fashionable young things have spent the weekend drinking champagne and partying.

As the guests gather for dinner on Sunday evening, however, they are met not by their host but by the Scotland Yard detective Austin McClue, who brings them shocking news: Lord Jagged has been murdered! And they are the principal suspects in the policeman's enquiries!

One - or more - of you is a murderer! Your task is to discover who that killer is. Fortunately detective McClue is on hand to assist your investigations.

First the invites, you choose which of your friends play which devious suspect and invite them to come along as that character. Then the shopping list, menu suggestions and recipes. Plus of course...a really tasty murder to solve.

30261.name: Bushwhackin' Varmints out of Sergio's Butte
30261.description:
The eighth addition to the B-Movie Series introduces Westerns to the line. It parodies western movie cliches with 120 cards capable of being used as a stand alone game or being mixed with other B-Movie Series games.

Players play characters, props, and locations to create their own western themed movies, while also playing creature cards to attack other player's movies. Special Effects cards can be used to perform extra actions to mix up the standard play or modify creature attacks. The goal of the game is to have the highest scoring movie when the "Roll the Credits" card is played or when the draw deck is emptied.

30262.name: Cleave
30262.description:
Cleave can be played on a checker board. Each player starts with 16 soldiers 8 on each of the back ranks and 8 on the third ranks. All soldiers move like chess rooks. There are two ways to capture the opponents soldiers, by custodian and by intervention.
