Custodian capturing is accomplished by ending one of your soldiers movement next to an opponent's while having one of your own on the opposite side as well. To capture by intervention you move one of your soldiers directly between two opposing soldiers and then capture both soldiers on each side. The edge of the board can be used to complete any line of three, capturing an opponent piece near the edge by either custodian or intevention. The game is played until one opponent has no legal moves, which he then loses. A player also loses if he is reduced to two or less soldiers.

Hosted for online play by SuperDuperGames.ORG, where it is known as "Mak-Yek".

30263.name: Fisch mich
boardgamefamily: HABA Game in a Tin series
30263.description:
Big and small anglers meet at the tin pond for the yearly angling competition. Even Andrew Angler is wielding his fishing rod.
Suddenly a green fish finger turns up and yells "Fish for me!" Andrew Angler rubs his eyes. There! A second fish finger and a red pufferfish swim toward him chorusing "Catch me! Catch me!"
But unfortunately Andrew Angler may only catch yellow fish in this angling round. So he has to be careful: as if he gets close to a wrong fish ... snap! The fish will be clinging to his fishing rod.

Who, with some skill and a bit of luck, will catch the most fish?

30264.description:
The third in the designer's series on the Roman Empire, published in Vae Victis 74 (May 2007), Ultimus Romanorum is similar to his previous games Imperator and Semper Victor.

Ultimus Romanorum depicts the end of the Western Roman Empire from 364AD onwards. One player takes the Romans, the other plays the various forces acting against the Empire.
30264.name: Ultimus Romanorum: La Chute de Rome

30265.name: Mix N Match
30265.description: This is an educational game intended to teach children about primary and secondary colors. This game uses clear plastic discs of various colors which, when stacked, produce other colors. Children move these colored tiles to create the most colors and collect the most points.

30266.name: Number Game
30266.description: This is a number/picture tile matching game intended to teach young children basic number concepts including recognizing, naming, grouping, and counting. The game of counting has versatile rules that can be readily adapted to different skill levels. Game uses various tiles with item pictures and the numbers 1-25 which interlock.

30267.description:
This game simulates owning a hockey franchise. Owners guide their team through a season and playoffs.

Owners spend money to increase their team's skill and roll dice, modified by skill points, to generate game scores against other owner's teams during the season. Periodically a team must draw a card from one of two decks that alter the fortunes of the team, for good or bad.

Play continues until a 40-game season is completed. Teams are seeded into a playoff tree. Each 7-game round, the winner moves on until there is a champion.
30267.name: Franchise Mania

30268.description:
From the expansion pack:

This package contains 9 straight road sections to expand your Car Wars track layout. 27 color counters showing trees, bushes, hedges, and green paint clouds.

Expands:

Car Wars
30268.name: Car Wars Deluxe Road Sections Set 3: Straights

30269.description:
From the expansion pack:

This package contains 9 assorted road sections to expand your Car Wars track layout. The contents include: 1 crossroad, 2 right hand turnouts, 2 left hand turnouts, and 4 half-length straight road sections.

Also included are 46 assorted counters depicting water on the road, ice, paint clouds, potholes, and a toll booth.

Expands:

Car Wars
30269.name: Car Wars Deluxe Road Sections Set 2: Intersections

30271.name: K-BAR And Bayonet
boardgamepublisher: And That's The Way It Was...
30271.description:
From the Rulebook:

Rules for Platoon and Squad level gaming that will allow a reasonable recreation of the ferocious small unit infantry actions in the Pacific theatre of operations.

30272.description: A 1:1 tactical ww2 miniature game on battlegroup level. many supplental rules and scenarios in VaeVictis magazine.
30272.name: Section D'Assaut

30273.name: High King of Tara
boardgameversion: SoA subscription game in grip top bag
30273.description:
High King of Tara is a card game that recreates the struggle to become High King of Ireland in the period following the death of Brian Boru in 1014.

The players are each a king seeking to become High King through politics, coalitions, marriage, alliances and combat.

30274.name: Bugles, Boots 'n Saddles
boardgamepublisher: And That's The Way It Was...
30274.description:
From the Rulebook:

"Being a set of playable, entertaining and enjoyable skirmish-level rules that can recreate the excitement and savagery of the countless skirmishes, patrol and raids in the American West in the late 1800's

30275.name: In The Heart Of Africa
boardgamepublisher: HLBS Publishing (The Honourable Lead Boiler Suit Company)
30275.description: Wargames rules for the period of Exploration and Imperialism in "Darkest Africa" from 1860 to 1899.

boardgamepublisher: And That's The Way It Was...
30276.description:
A Variant for "The Sword And The Flame".

From the rulebook:

"Being a set of playable, entertaining and enjoyable skirmish-level rules that can recreate the excitement and savagery of the countless forays, skirmishes and raids in the islands of the West Indies in the 1700's."

Expands:

The Sword and the Flame
30276.name: The Sword in the Caribbean: Pirate Forays Along The Spanish Main

30277.name: Astounding Tales
boardgamepublisher: And That's The Way It Was...
boardgameversion: And That's The Way It Was Edition
30277.description:
From the rulebook:

This is a short and deliberately incomplete set of rules for mayhem, murder and Weird Horror set in the period between the 1920 and the end of the black and white B movie era in the 1950s.

30278.name: With Ol' Gimlet Eye
boardgamepublisher: And That's The Way It Was...
30278.description:
A skirmish level game using a variation of "The Sword and the Flame" covering the U.S. Marines in Nicaragua between 1912 and 1933

From the rulebook:

"Being a set of playable, entertaining and enjoyable skirmish-level rules that can recreate the excitement and intensity og the countless ambushes, patrols and raids in the American interventions in Central America"

30279.name: Future Wars
boardgameexpansion: Chap with wings there, Five Rounds Rapid!
boardgamepublisher: HLBS Publishing (The Honourable Lead Boiler Suit Company)
30279.description: A 1:1 skirmish system covering anything from corporate troops, street gangs, zombies and alien bugs to predators.

30280.name: Kukkokiemuu!
30280.description: Players have to gather the different animals of the farm together. Everytime the die is cast it gives the sound of one of the animals and in that way tells you what to do next.

30281.description: The dragon and the unicorn came to free the world from the tyranny of Ashran, the black magician. Players take role of the heroes from the famous books, Jack, Victoria, Kirtash, Aslan, Shail and Kitara, who want to destroy Ashran and the Shreks. Travel around Idhun and face the challenges, which are met on the way. Extend your talents, because they are needed in the final battle, in order to achieve the victory over Ashran and the Shreks. Free the secret world Idhun!
30281.name: Geheime Welt Idhun
boardgamepodcastepisode: Geheime Welt Idhun - Ein fantastisches Abenteuer?

30282.name: Pesca Polar
30282.description:
From the box:

"Become a Eskimo and go to fish in the open ice. Run to your igloo when you have you food, if you are the first you won. But beware the blizzard and the polar bear, it's very hungry and if catch you they'll eat all your fishes."

Each player in turns takes the dice and roll it and move his token the number of spaces showed in the dice. But if the die show a bear icon, you roll the bear dice and apply it's effects

And kids games from Educa Borras.

30283.name: Sen-Tens cards
30283.description:
Sen-Tens cards is a card game where each player makes "headline-style" sentences using the cards in their hand as well as the cards available in the community pile.

Each player gets four cards, and four cards are set in the middle. On each turn a player makes a sentence, which is scored by adding the numbers on each card in the sentence. When complete, the cards are set aside, and the community cards are replaced from the deck for the next player in turn. Play continues until someone cannot make a sentence.

30284.name: Keeping Up With the Jones'
30284.description: Players try to out do each other by acquiring a house and material possessions and eventually being debt-free. The game involves auctions, rebates, shopping sprees, liens, and housing upkeep.

30286.description:
Players try to surround the most land squares around their farmhouse. They do this by placing tree trunks to try and separate the different coloured farmhouses. Each trunk must be connected to a previous trunk. As soon as all farm houses are separated, players count the land they have surrounded. The player with the most land wins!

An online version can be found at: http://www.mastermoves.eu/allgames.php?gametypeid=4
30286.name: Territories

30287.description:
Buying castles in Scotland can turn out to be excellent business. Even more so when, at the same time, you can provide tourists with these lands attractions: natural beauties? Oh no, no, rather offering them scary ghost infestations!!! Some eccentric characters fight in an auction to be assigned castles and manors. This, in the hope that presences will not be too numerous! Even if a castle without ghosts may be found useless, on the contrary one which is too “populated” will end up terrorizing tourists and being valueless...

Every player, after having seen the various castles, can declare what was seen, by showing his signs “picture” or “ghost”.
Were there gloomy presences or only old and powdery family portraits? But beware, not all declarations are reliable: many players could lie... or perhaps all of them?

In the first phase players must decide whether in that very turn they will lie or tell always the truth.
Mrs Truelight could help everyone to find out actual results of such decisions, but she is greedy and therefore she will reveal precious indications only to best bidders.

Caution is vital: the ones who pay more money too early will turn out having less funds to offer in the second phase auction for castles. Shall we have enough money to steal best ones to our competitors? Every castle has a score according to the number of ghosts by whom it is haunted.

The player who succeeds in guessing where ghosts are and their exact number will achieve optimum business, becoming able to buy what he/she wants in a fairly relaxed mode and allowing himself/herself even the luxury to mislead adversaries with fake offers.

Ghost for sale is a clever deductive game, with a subtle bluffing component, for 3 to 5 players, suitable for all the families, but with a strategy component that will not leave indifferent even most experienced gamers. In the box there are 8 special cards to be used for “special auctions”, which constitute a set for playing advanced rules games and which, randomly combined to the various castles and manors, guarantee rounds which are always exciting and different.

English, German and Italian Rules available for download here
30287.name: Ghost for Sale

30288.name: Jalkapallopeli: Fotbollspelet
30288.description:
A football (soccer) simulation for 2-players from the glory days of old DDR.

Jalkapallopeli means footballgame in finnish, and Fotbollsspelet means the same in swedish

I really expect this game coming from Finland

30289.name: Västkustspelet
30289.description: Västkustspelet is a trivia game (basically a Trivial Pursuit clone), with questions about the Swedish west coast.

30290.name: Space Voyage
30290.description:
Acting as a Commander in the Space Voyage fleet, players construct, crew and kit out a ship to voyage amongst the stars, seeking out rare minerals, avoiding alien races and trying to return to Earth as the richest Commander of the Fleet.

You start by trying to complete your ship, which is mostly a luck-driven process, before launching the ship into the void. Once launched, players try to land on mineral rich planets, but there are many hazards to avoid.

The game ends when at least two ships have returned to Earth. At this point there is a final semi-random determination of each player's holdings. All loans are settled and the winner of the game is the player with the most money.

30291.name: World War II Game
30291.description: This is part of the Learningames History Series. In it, you learn about World War II and the battles that were fought. There are three levels of play included in the rules; Basic Game, Identify the Location of the Event, and Identify the Event Based on the Location. The winner of the game is the player with the most cards.

30292.name: The Easter Game
30292.description: The goal of the game is to collect 2 jelly beans, 2 eggs, and 2 chicks. Each player has a spinner with these objects depicted on them and the first to claim all of them wins.

30293.name: Price of Glory
30293.description:
From the publisher website:

Introducing our new WWI system, this is a stand alone game, allowing you to game small unit WWI actions. Rules include infantry, cavalry, artillery, vehicles, plus barbed wire, trench crossing, gas, and more. Troop lists are very flexible, allowing you to decide what you need to fight. Players of DH/C7B will be familiar with some mechanics, but you do not need DH/C7B to play.

30294.description:
From the publisher website:

This is Iron Ivan Games's new supplement for small unit and vehicle skirmish for modern battles. New rules cover Command and Control, Fire Doctrine, Rabble Factor, plus new equipment like ATGMs, Body Armor, Night Vision, and more. Extensive section on the use of helicopters, and modern aircraft. Also included are two conflict modules, War at the Bottom of the World: The Falklands (British and Argentine Forces), and Militia Wars of Somalia (Somali Militias plus US Rangers and Delta Force), which include appropriate infantry, artillery, vehicle, helicopter and aircraft entries. 52 pages in all. The main Disposable Heroes and Coffin For Seven Brothers rules are required for play.

Expands:

Disposable Heroes and Coffin For Seven Brothers
30294.name: Seek Out, Close With, And Destroy.
boardgameexpansion: Disposable Heroes and Coffin For Seven Brothers

30295.name: Disposable Heroes and Coffin for Seven Brothers: Red Sun, Red Death
boardgameexpansion: Disposable Heroes and Coffin For Seven Brothers
30295.description: The first Theater Expansion for Disposable Heroes and Coffin For Seven Brothers covers the war in the Pacific with the Japanese, the USMC and the Chinese Army.

30296.description:
From the publisher website:

The Fight Against Tyranny in the Early Days of World War II, 1939-1940: Includes the information you need to field French, Belgian, Dutch, Norwegian, Danish, Polish, and Finnish troops. 80 pages of infantry platoons, artillery, vehicles and aircraft. As a bonus, information for the Continuation War Finns is included. Note: Early War Germans are found in Angriff!, Early War British are found in Go Forward Together.

An Early Days expansion for Disposable Heroes and Coffin For Seven Brothers
30296.name: Disposable Heroes and Coffin for Seven Brothers: Futile Gallantry
boardgameexpansion: Disposable Heroes and Coffin For Seven Brothers

30297.name: Trouble Catch
30297.description:
A boardgame based on the Japanese comic strip Urusei Yatsura. Each player plays one of four characters from the comic: Lum, Ataru, Mendo or Shinobu. The players compete to obtain presents.

Components include mapsheet, stand up figures, and 3-d presents.

30298.name: Hush!
30298.description:
Hush! is a children's game with no strategy involved, so everyone is equally good!

Each turn, a player turns over one of the hidden tiles. If it is a strawberry, then he or she can take it. If it is a bird, the collected strawberries are "saved" and put aside. If it is a scarecrow, the player must say "HUSH!", and all other players must put back all strawberries they haven't saved yet.

The game ends when all tiles are taken, and the winner is the one with the most strawberries.

Important hint from the rules: If someone has not learned to count yet, the players can stack all strawberries and compare height instead.

Contents:

54 tiles with pictures of strawberries, birds and scarecrows

30300.name: Sheriff of Dodge City
30300.description: A simple game in which players must spin a spinner to determine movement. If a player reaches a space with an outlaw token they spin the spinner again to see whether they "hit" and capture the outlaw (picking up the token) or miss and have to move again. The first player to capture at least three outlaws and get back to Dodge City wins.

30301.name: Let's F*ck!
30301.description:
From the publisher:

"Do you like to F*ck? If so, you'll love this f*cking game! Use the spinner to move around the board until one of your markers lands on the bed. Then you spin the spinner and start F*cking in the position the spinner points to."

Components: Board, spinner, four pawns.

30302.name: Porn!
30302.description:
From the publisher:

"Porn! is an easy-to-learn strategy card game where you and the other players compete to own the most porn movies. As you build your stash, you also try to prevent other players from building larger collections. You can steal movies by correctly answering a porn trivia question, triple your holdings with the Porn Mogul Card, and earn extra turns by filming a movie. Running out of cards closes the round, but watch out for the Arson! card that can destroy it all."

30303.description:
Aim to attract the most agile ninja into your new Ninja School, supply them with equipment then send them out to attack other ninja schools to maintain your position as the best master.

Players collect ninja in 7 different styles of fighting, each ninja being of different strength. The game ends when one person has played one ninja from five different styles into their school or seven ninjas in total from any style. Points are scored for the value of the ninja and bonuses depending on how many styles are in the school and how many ninja are in each style.

Players may equip their ninja with items to improve their strength, stealth or weapons which are kept hidden until they are attacked or are sent out to attack another players ninja.
30303.name: Ninja School

30304.name: The Wacky Tobacky Dice Game
30304.description:
From the publisher:

"The crazy game of pot slang! A player rolls the dice, then selects two of the dice and announces a unique two-word pot slang term. This term must make sense to the other players.
Examples are 'Bong Water', 'Pot Head', and 'Grass Brownies'. For 2-5 players."

30305.name: That's Disgusting
30305.description:
From the publisher:

"The hilarious drinking game where you and your friends attempt to OUT GROSS each other. Four gruesome categories and over 400 disgusting actions! Ham it up by doing overacted impersonations, name items that fit into vulgar categories, judge your friends in their efforts to gross each other out, and much, much more!!! Packaged in a dog poop shaped tin."

Components: Deck of cards, pad, pencil, custom six-sided die.

30306.name: What the F*ck?
30306.description:
From the publisher's website:

"Try to guess what other players are going to answer to the most ridiculous set of questions imaginable. If you do not correctly predict a player's response, you take a one-, two- or three-drink penalty. The game includes over 400 questions. It is the most flexible drinking game in the world! Players can easily enter and exit the game and you can play with anywhere from 2 to over 100 players."

Components: Two booklets, three six-sided dice, A & B tokens.

30307.name: Hump!
30307.description:
"The game of erotic education and sexual satisfaction!"

"You and your lover learn about each other's libidos while traveling around the game board. The woman asks the man erotic questions about how to please her, and the man asks the woman erotic questions about how to please him. Some cards offer general love-making tips and others are more personal to the likes and dislikes of the lover asking the question. The winner enjoys the reward of selecting three cards to interpret and act out during lovemaking."

"Includes: a durable gameboard, 52 Ask Him cards, 52 Ask Her cards, two game markers, a die, and easy-to-follow instructions. Packaged in an attractive game tin!"

30308.name: Noddy-spillet
30308.description:
The players searches for Noddy and his friends all around Toy Land by finding pieces of their puzzle.

The first player to complete his puzzle and return to the starting square is the winner.

Contents:

Game board
12 pices with Noddy and his friends
4 wooden pawns
4 puzzles
Die

30309.name: Zombie Wars
30309.description:
Zombie Wars is a quick tactical game for 2 to 4 players. Each player starts the game with a small horde of zombies. During the game you attack clusters of townspeople, adding those who die to your horde. Your goal is to build a zombie horde that’s large enough to annihilate the hordes of your rivals. If you have the most zombies on the board at the end of the game, you win.

Zombie Wars uses a custom board, tokens, and zombie horde tracker; a bunch of tokens; about 12 six-sided dice; at least two eight-sided dice; and a few ten-, twelve-, and twenty-sided dice. A four-player game takes about 90 minutes to play. Zombie Wars is appropriate for ages 15 and older.

Home Page: http://www.invisible-city.com/play/446/zombie-wars (free rules, board, and pieces)

30310.name: The Comical Game of Mother Hubbard
30310.description: Based on the nursery rhyme. Be the first player to fill your cupboard with each of four items: grapes, bread, fish, and a bone!

30311.name: Mitt aller første kryssordspill
30311.description:
Mitt aller første kryssordspill (My very first crosswords game) is a game that introduces children to the concept of crosswords. During a turn, the player must try to find as many letters as possible to a given word amongst the hidden letters.

There are two game boards, one for the smallest children with with all letters written down, and one for older children that can spell, with some blank squares.

Contents:

2 game boards
84 letter tiles

30312.name: Multimillionær
30312.description:
Multimillionær (Multi-millionaire) is a Monopoly-like game, but with more advanced economics.

The game includes a stock market, and if one player owns more that 8 (of the 10) stocks of a colour, he or she will get 50% of the income.

Also, there are no prison, only the "Ideal holiday resort", in which the players must pay (progressively more) to stay each round.

There is no income for a completed round, instead there is a dummy pawn traveling around paying rent to the players.

The game ends if all but one player are bankrupt, if one player has 2 million kroner in values, or at a given time.

30313.name: Månetoppen
30313.description:
Månetoppen (Moon Top) is a spin-off from the children's television show "Jul på Månetoppen" (Christmas at Moon Top) by NRK (Norwegian Broadcasting Corporation).

The players must collect as many blueberries as possible before the winter comes.

After finding a blueberry, they can immediately to the start square, or continue searching for blueberry, risking to lose the bucket and all collected berries.

Players
Contents:

Game board
4 pawns
36 månetoppen cards
45 blueberry cards
4 blueberry buckets

30314.name: Final Argument of Kings
30314.description:
Final Argument of Kings is a product of the same circle of players and designers who produced the Squad Leader board game and the Johnny Reb Civil War miniature rules. Final Argument bears a strong resemblance to the latter but was designed to tune to the warfare of the middle part of the 18th century. These rules are appropriate for games set from the time of the War of the Polish Succession (1734) to the beginning of the Wars of the French Revolution (1789.) It is scaled to be appropriate for battle on the European continent. For 15mm figures, one inch on the table represents 45-50 yards.

Horse and foot units are each four stands and represent infantry battalions and cavalry regiments. Artillery batteries are single stands as are army, wing, and brigade commanders. The number of figures per unit is variable with each figure representing 40 soldiers or one section of artillery. Stand size is variable with the number of figures so that units with more men cover a wider frontage. (The game would be playable with other basing systems, but the game's basing has a number of subtleties that transmit the tactical feel of the time. For example, units are longer in march column than they are wide in line as, indeed, they should be.)

Turns follow a set sequence with simultaneous movement and fire of various types. Each turn represents 20 minutes of time. Players mark orders for units that are hidden from the opposing player. Command is an important element but does not dominate the game or become obtrusive. There is also provision for grand tactical movement so that maneuver and closing to battle may happen quickly without taking too much time nor sacrificing tactical detail. Combat tends to be bloody with stands taking figure losses as a result. Morale of units is a key game concept. Units have a basic morale point that is altered by loss of strength and the local situation faced by the units. Battlefield events trigger morale checks. There are no saving roles.

30316.name: 1650 more Questions & Answers for use with Trivial Pursuit: Set I, Group I
30316.description:
From the Back of the Box:

1650 more Questions & Answers for use with Trivial Pursuit...

Happy triviaphiles will recognize the Q&A's in this set from Set I of the award-winning Game of Trivia by the Avalon Hill Game company.

Now - we make these same questions & answers available for devotees of Trivial Pursuit, without having you pay for a complete game.

Here - in this box - are 1,650 additional Q&A's, color-coded for play with Trivial Pursuit (and other similar games of trivia).

And... if 1,650 of them aren't enough, check out the additional groups - labeled 1 thru 4 - to complete the set of 6,600 additional questions and answers.

OMNI Magazine - December '84 - selected Game of Trivia by The Avalon Hill Game Company... "best trivia game of the year, based on its variety of questions and low ratio of arguable answers."

GAMES Magazine - September '84 - editors' choice for GAMES 100 because... "Game of Trivia plays more like a true board game, and there's no reason why you can't use the questions for Trivial Pursuit."

30317.name: Kahovka: Wrangel's Kursk, Oct. 14, 1920
30317.description:
On October 14, 1920, the last major White offensive took place. It would become Wrangel's Kursk, a precursor to that more famous WW2 battle at Kursk but this happened at Kakhovka, a small town astride the Dnepr River.

Unique for it was only the second time in the RCW that a mass tank attack would occur (the first was in the Summer of 1919), fully supported by DH9A bombers and infantry against a very well prepared Red defense consisting of three consecutive trench lines, mines and barb wire. WW1 was in effect "revisited". General Wrangel placed his blind faith in the tanks he had procured from the British, His tankers were well trained. He had even developed a combined arms approach. His forces, though outnumbered by 2 to 1 or more, continued to fight the "good fight" and had busted out of the Crimea in June, sent the Reds fleeing backwards for hundreds of miles with mass tank attacks and the ideal flat land. However, Wrangel was unable to secure the town of Kakhovka. The town had little real tactical value except for the fact the Reds held it. In September, several battles had been fought for it, each time the Whites were repulsed. Oct. 14th would be the last one.

The Reds had created antitank formation consisting of MkV and FT-17 tanks and a unique American weapon, the Maklen 37mm AA gun. True, they only had a few of them , but the weapons ability to penetrate armor at very long distances was a stopper. Artillery units in AT mode also had been created. In manpower, the Reds had overwhelming strength if they did not flee from the tanks as they approached.

The stage was set for the massive tank assault (in RCW terms) and for the final show-down between White and Red.

Game scale is 1 hr turns, 800 yd a hex, company level, individual MkV, Whippet, Ft-17 tanks, Austin Armor Cars, DH9A Aircraft. The system never plays the same as once never knows how many units they can activate.

30318.description:
Inspired by ancient art, Tesserae combines elements of dominoes and jigsaw puzzles to form a game of shapes and patterns. Since it doesn't rely on a square grid, tiles will fit together in interesting and surprising ways. The basic game provides a good blend of strategy and luck, while advanced rules allow for either pure skill games, or ones where luck is more of a factor. Suitable for solitaire, one to five individual players, and several combinations of teams.

The game of Tesserae pits players against one another, meshing colored tiles into the ever-evolving play field, each trying to exhaust their supply of tiles while preventing their opponents from doing the same. Skillful strategy can pay off, but be careful -- things can change on the luck of a draw! This is a game that will stretch your brain.
30318.name: Tesserae

30319.name: Snowball Fighting
30319.description:
Designed specifically for play by mail, this is an un-copyrighted multi-player game of snowball fighting.

Players write orders for simultaneous resolution using a simple action point system. Options include moving, collecting snow, several types of throws and a number of specific actions with the board features (conifers, snowmen and a shed).

30320.name: Dutchman, Spaniard, Switzer, Swede
30320.description:
The game is designed to cover land warfare in Europe 1618-1660. The emphasis is on continental warfare rather than the English Civil War. Scale in one inch = 40 yards for 15mm figures, one figure = 50 men and each turn represents 30-45 minutes.

The basic unit is a regiment or brigade sized unit depending on the national force being represented. These are then organized into Division which are in turn organized into Wings. Two or more wings is an army. During play each unit receives a number of actions called Operations depending on a variety of situation factors. These are then used to execute movement and other tactical operations.

The rules provide diagrams of historical formations, army lists, and scenarios for the battles of Lutzen (1632), Jankow (1645 -- erroneously listed as 1635 in the contents page) and Anfangsthal (1644). A separate expansion, called for God, King, Pulk and Orta provides additional optional rules as well as additional army lists for Eastern Europe and the English Civil War.

30322.name: Screech
30322.description:
Glow-in-the-Dark Concentration.

Screech uses a plastic owl that tells you the type of "insect" to find by showing the insect in its eyes. Players search through cards and place the cards in the owl to determine if they have the right card. (The owl has a flashlight inside the unit to flash the image on the cards to make them glow in the dark).

boardgamehonor: 2008 JoTa Best 2-Player Board Game Nominee
2008 JoTa Best Abstract Board Game Nominee
30323.description:
The Mosquito pieces can be added to a standard Hive set before the start of the game giving each player 12 pieces to play with.

During the game, they are placed in the same way as the other pieces. Once in play, the Mosquito takes on the movement characteristics of any creature it touches at the time, thus changing its characteristics throughout the game.

Exception: If moved as a Beetle on top of the Hive, it continues to move as a Beetle until it climbs down from the Hive.
30323.name: Hive: The Mosquito
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Boardgame Review Room - Hive with Expansions

boardgamehonor: 2008 Golden Geek Best Party Board Game Nominee
30324.description:
Ca$h 'n Gun$: Live is a sequel to Ca$h 'n Gun$, not an extension - although it does come with a bonus special power to extend its predecessor.

8 to 20 players play in a public place where non-players are present. When the referee blows the whistle, all players points their hands (as if they had a gun) towards another player...all this in a public place!

Of course, players are gangsters sharing a lot of money.

Though ostensibly a LARP game, and on the cusp of being outside the scope of BGG, it retains inclusion as a group activity not dissimilar from Werewolf.

The game was released end August 2007.
30324.name: Ca$h 'n Gun$: Live
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episodio 11 – Especial verano 2013: Juegos no jugados

30326.description:
Tower Attack is the first major expansion for the Battleground: Crossbows & Catapults War Chest Starter Set.

Expand your Knights vs Orc battles with 36 new pieces.

Publisher: Moose, Melbourne Australia
30326.name: Battleground: Crossbows & Catapults Tower Attack Expansion Pack
boardgameexpansion: Battleground: Crossbows & Catapults War Chest Starter Set

30327.description: Expand your Knights vs Orc Battleground: Crossbows & Catapults War Chest Starter Set battles with these three new minor expansions for the Battleground: Crosbows & Catapults game.
30327.name: Battleground: Crossbows & Catapults Twin Attack Armory Packs
boardgameexpansion: Battleground: Crossbows & Catapults War Chest Starter Set

boardgamehonor: 2007 Golden Geek Best Children's Board Game Nominee
2008 Golden Geek Best Children's Board Game Nominee
30328.description:
Battleground: Crossbows & Catapults puts you in the middle of a real fantasy battle and can be played on almost any flat surface.

Carefully place your weapons and warriors to take out your opponent's forces and defenses, Knight or Orc.

Load up the elastic powered weapons to launch the battle discs to do maximum damage to your opponent's side. Use your moves to strategically place your warriors and weapons to both defend your castle and attack your enemy. Aim for the flags and win bonus lives!

Be the first to knock over all your enemies to win!

Includes two complete armies, Knights and Orcs. 80 pieces in total.

First edition in 1983 as Crossbows & Catapults
30328.name: Battleground: Crossbows & Catapults War Chest Starter Set
boardgameexpansion: Battleground: Crossbows & Catapults Tower Attack Expansion Pack
Battleground: Crossbows & Catapults Twin Attack Armory Packs

30329.name: Space Explorer
30329.description: Described in the book Beyond Competition, Space Explorer is a cooperative game where players take turns controlling a space ship going from planet to planet. Distance and direction is determined by a deck of cards (1-6 in four suits). The game is a race against time measured in deck reshuffles.

30330.name: Do-To-Ho Table Hockey
30330.description:
Do-To-Ho Table Hockey is completely different from other table hockey games. The play figures are not fastened to rods, but are mobile on the whole playing field. In their bases just like in the puck there is a ball bearing, so they slide like ice skate runners all over the board. Moving a play figure is done via a short, unique knock against the figure with a small stick as in the case for billiard. The play courses take place alternating, there are 'attack courses', with which the puck may be played by a play figure, and 'position courses' (defense courses as well as offside release courses), with which a play figure only may change position without touching the puck. Puck possession changes, if the aggressor misses the puck or hits an opposing play figure. Do-To-Ho was developed in Germany and published in 1994. Until now (2007) there are about 200 exemplars, all handmade. The antecessor of Do-To-Ho was Stahlkugelhockey (=Iron Ball Hockey), developed by the same author in 1980. For more informations and a Video please look at
www.tablehockey.de

30331.name: Weapons & Warriors Castle Storm / Pirate Clash Game
30331.description:
One player defends the castle with his soldiers, and the other player attacks it with his pirate force. The first player to knock over all his opponent's men and target cannons wins.

Contains 75 pieces drawn from Pirate Clash: http://www.boardgamegeek.com/game/7184 and Castle Siege: http://www.boardgamegeek.com/game/861 (about half of each set).

Castle tower and walls
Pirate Ship
Catapult
Crossbow
Cannon
Mortar
Brig
3 Palisades
14 Soldiers
10 Pirates
24 Battleballs
12 Cannon targets
12 Latches
4 Palm Trees
2 Dice
Cardboard scenery

30332.name: Groups
30332.description:
From the author: Groups is related to Lines of Action, with the differences being that pieces in Groups move only one space, only orthogonal connections count, there are no captures, and the game begins with a drop phase. The game also bears a resemblance to Teeko, with the movement of pieces to attain a configuration, although in Groups a winning configuration can take any form provided all pieces are orthogonally connected. I had been playing it [the game with no jump rule] and found that it eventually bogged down with defensive play. I wanted to speed it up some, so I added a rule that a piece was allowed to jump over another piece to an empty space. I thought this would open the game up more. What I had found is that the game grew immensely more dynamic, and much more offensive, and finished a lot faster. What would go on from 30 turns for a game usually now finished up in under 10. The play balance seems the same now, but the game is a lot faster.

Designer's Note: For individuals who would prefer a more strategic, and less tactical, game eliminate the jump move in the game (see the entry in the variants section).

Online Play


Super Duper Games

30333.description:
Civilization CHR is an alternate gaming system for "Sid Meier's Civilization" from Eagle Games (2002).
Consider it as a group-up rewrite of the original game still using all of the original components adding new cards and pieces.

The game mechanics are similar to the original one but enhanced and revised to make it a whole new experience for a typical "Civilization" fan.

Civilization CHR goals are:
1) Add variety to game strategies
2) Reduce the "Risk effect"
3) Reduce Luck (introducing balancing rules)
4) Give a chance to catch up on to unlucky players
5) Implement some additional PC game rules
6) Increase realism and players interaction
7) General game speed up (slowed down by new rules)
8) Better time management in slow phases or deadlocks
9) Having more "suspense" with destabilizing or unpredictable events
10) Increase simultaneous player goals

This boardgame cannot be purchased because it is free, so it has to be downloaded and "printed" from the publisher. In addition to this, you must own the original "Sid Meier's Civilization" from Eagle Games.

Re-implements:

Sid Meier's Civilization: The Boardgame
30333.name: Civilization CHR

30334.name: Fort Boyard
30334.description:
This game is based on the French TV Game Show "Fort Boyard".
Fort Boyard' is a real fort located on the west coast of France, built to protect the arsenal of Rochefort and finished 1857. Later used as a prison.

Players examine rooms to get keys with which they can open at the end of the game a chest filled with gold. Some keys are obtainable by answering questions or solving riddles, other keys only by physical challenges. A timer rises tension to fulfill the quests.

30335.name: Murdero
30335.description: Murdero is a fixed deck collectible card game with a Murder Mystery theme. The aim of the game is to complete sets of case cards to solve murders. There are 45 case cards numbered 1 to 5 and 15 action cards in the deck. Action cards alter the gameplay mechanics. Additional decks can be added, and players are encouraged to design their own deck builds by adding or removing case and action cards.

30336.name: Animal Fair
30336.description:
Card game with a deck of 40 animal cards. As each card is turned over players collect cards by being the first player to correctly make the sound of the animal pictured on the card.

Link to rules now posted below.

30337.name: Allie Patriot Game
30337.description:
World War One era Patriotic card game features a deck of 48 cards for US, Britain, France and Italy. Actually this card deck features 5 different games.
1. Liberty Bond Game 2-4 Players try to collect the most Liberty bond cards while getting rid of all their other cards.
2. Organization3 - 5 Players A bidding and trick taking game where the country listed on the first card turned over acts as trumps. You must follow suit, play off suit of use a trump card to win the trick.
3. Mobilization A memory testing game for from 3 to 8 players.Somewht like Go Fish.

4. Mobilization 2 Sort of a solatiare game with the object being to build up 8 piles with all of the cards from a particular conutry.

5. Mobilization 3 A two person game where you try to mobilize all of the cards that you hold.

6 Sham Battle a bidding game where layers bid to determine county in power somewhat similar to game of canasta with different combinations being worth different values.Flag and Army of any nation worth 10 points, flag and aramy of Country in powere worth 40 points etc.

7. Sham Battle 2 try to accumulated different combinations of different cards.

30338.name: All Star Comics Card Game
30338.description: A trick taking card game featuring famous cartoon characters from the 1920's and 1930's. The dealer turns a card to determine a penalty suit. If Krazy Kat, Ignatz Mouse or Offissa Pup are turned up, the dealer may choose the suit before he looks at his cards or he just turns the next card to determine the suit. After all the tricks are taken, each player puts one coin in the pot for each penalty suit card taken. If any players take no penalty suit cards then they win the pot.

30339.name: Car Wars Expansion Set #10
30339.description:
This expansion includes duplicate counters from Dueltrack and Expansion Sets 3, 4, 5, 7, and 8. It also included a cardstock "spinner" that had to be assembled and whose purpose was to ease cross referencing handling class and speed to find resulting die roll for possible consequence.

Expands:

Car Wars

30340.name: The Celestial Companions
30340.description: Marriage, Marriage is what brings us together today, Marriage, that blessed union that dream within a dream. Marriage is fun, Learning each other's quirks, spending time with your in-laws, and bouncing back from silly disagreements, who wouldn't want to do that for eternity? It's couples versus couples in this hysterical game where you and your spouse will discover how much you really know or don't know about your significant other! Newlyweds, couples with children, and even those celebrating their fiftieth wedding anniversary will enjoy this lighthearted lurch into eternal marriage.

30341.name: Resources
30341.description:
Described in the book Beyond Competition, Resources is a cooperative game where players take turns collecting resources on the game board. The object of the game is to keep the distribution of the four resources between the players as even as possible.

Movement on the board is done by jumping when possible or moving to a spot when not. Bonus are awarded when all the players have the same number of a particular resources. Penalty points for a resource are given at the end of the game for each resource another player lags behind the leader. If the resulting score is positive - everyone wins; if negative - everyone loses.

30342.name: Pinky Lee and the Runaway Frankfurters
30342.description:
A frankfurter is placed on each one of the designated spaces along the track on the gameboard. In turn, each player rolls the die and advances one's own wagon along the track. The first to land on each frankfurter captures it and loads it on one's own wagon. Landing on an opponent forces the opponent to surrender all the owned frankfurters to the frankfurter hiding place at the finish line. The first to arrive at the finish line captures all the frankfurters that are there. The player with the most frankfurters after all have finished is the weiner (pun intended).

Pinky Lee was a Vaudeville comedian who achieved fame as the host of nationally televised children's show.

30343.name: Would You Believe?
30343.description: Spin and move game based on the TV show "Get Smart" . Players try to help max recover the payroll that was stolen by agents from KAOS.

30344.name: Sorry About That!
30344.description: Spin and move game that came on a single sheet of cardstock, from which the player punched out the playing pieces. Originally sold for 29 cents in discount stores.

30345.name: Get Smart Quiz Game
30345.description: Trivia Quiz game baed on the the TV show "Get Smart".

30346.name: Get Smart Card Game
30346.description: Card game based on the TV Show "Get Smart". Includes a peg board that is similiar to a cribbage board for keeping score.

30347.name: The Twilight Zone Game
30347.description: Board game based on the TV show "The Twilight Zone.

30348.name: Gomer Pyle
30348.description: Players race around the board, as Gomer Pyle, placing their men in to form a grand salute to Sergeant Carter.

30349.name: I'm George Gobel
30349.description:
Roll and Move game based on the NBC TV show "The George Gobel Show" which ran from 1954 thru 1960.

The game board features many of the famous "Gobelisms" that George would often say on the TV Show.

30350.name: My Fair Lady
30350.description: Children's game based on the Broadway Musical "My Fair Lady".

30351.name: A Trip Around the World
30351.description: Roll and move game with a travel theme. Players visit exotic locations and world Capitals. Starting and ending in New York.

30352.name: Bridge Dice
30352.description: Players have 3 rolls to try and spell B-R-I-D-G-E using the 6 custom dice. If a player spells bridge they get 6 points, bridg scores 3 points and brid scores 1 point. All other combinations score nothing. The first player to 15 points wins.

30353.name: Bild-a-gram
30353.description: Players begin the game by selecting a word or short phrase as the target. Players then take turns spinning the spinner that determines what letters they may take or how many letters they lose. The first player to spell out the target word or phrase wins.

30354.name: Salomo Junior
30354.description:
Salomo Junior is an expansion to Salomo 3000 Bible trivia. Expansion adds 1050 easier questions for children and 700 questions for adults.

Expands:

Salomo 3000

30355.name: Érase una vez...
30355.description:
Like in a memory game, you must pick up two tiles and if don't match try to remember it's position. But in "Érase una vez..." this idea is expanded, some tiles have special abilities that modify the game results.

As the title shows, in this game the theme is the Children's Tales, you receive bonus to match characters of the same tale.

30356.description:
West of the Mississippi, the grasslands of Middle America contain some of the richest farm land in the world, producing corn, soybeans, wheat, hay, and livestock. Purchased from France as part of the Louisiana Territory in 1803, the region was divided into square mile plots for the settlers from the east. In this game, players take the role of these settlers, developing the plots of land and establishing farms in America’s “Heartland.”

The game, entitled “Eine Frage der Ähre” in German, is a three-dimensional tile-laying game. Each tile contains two types of crops to be planted as well as a certain number of “barnyard points.” When placing tiles, players must always choose between scoring immediate “harvest” (victory) points or developing their farms through the barnyard points, which will provide victory points over the longer term. In addition, there is a race to the top of each barnyard point track in order to acquire the most valuable animals for the farm. Players may also “rotate crops” by using their tiles to cover up fields that bring their opponent’s points, possibly expanding their own farms in the process. This translates into an hour-long game aimed at families and gamers with multiple paths to victory.
Source: Jeffrey D. Allers
30356.name: Heartland

30357.name: Dune Buggy Rally
30357.description:
Each player assumes the role of a dune buggy racer. Each player takes a racer and puts it on start. In turn, each player rolls a die (the rules says dice but only one die is provided), advances one’s own dune buggy that number of spaces, takes chance card and follows the cards instructions. Landing on certain spaces and the cards award victory points. The player with the most victory points after all have finished wins the game.

The most outstanding feature of the game is its oversized (22 ½” x 36”) gameboard. The game is one of a series of “Gold Cup Games.”

30358.name: Horse Trail Ride
30358.description:
Each player assumes the role of a horse rider. Each player takes a horse and puts it on start. In turn, each player rolls a die (the rules says dice but only one die is provided), advances one’s own horse that number of spaces, takes chance card and follows the cards instructions. Landing on certain spaces and the cards award victory points. The player with the most victory points after all have finished wins the game.

The most outstanding feature of the game is its oversized (22 ½” x 36”) gameboard. The game is one of a series of “Gold Cup Games.”

30359.name: Not at All Trivial
30359.description: This is a trivia game intended for play specifically by families, including children (and extended family). The "trivia" questions focus on facts about the family members themselves (such as things they did while growing up, things in the family home, family ancestors, etc.) While not overtly religious, the game was marketed to a Latter-Day Saint (Mormon) audience.

30360.name: The Golden Plates Game
30360.description: This is religious-themed family card game has a set of cards which can be used in three different types of games: "Rameumptom" is a set collecting game similar to old main, "Who Am I?" is a trivia type game, and "Golden Plates" is a matching game. The cards contain images and information about historical characters from the Book of Mormon, a book of scripture of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints (Mormons).

30361.name: The Family Game
30361.description:
Loosely based on Chuck Barris' short-lived 1967 game show hosted by Bob Barker, each parent and child begins the game with a pawn on Start. The father reads a question aloud to one of the children and both write down their response. If the answers match, the father scores a card worth 25 points and he advances his pawn the number of spaces indicated on the card. If the answers do not match, the child’s pawn advances one space. The game continues with all players changing roles as questioner and responders. The winner is the player who scores 250 points.

Three of the spaces of the gameboard are marked "toy store". A player gets a chance card whenever landing here. Should a player land on the space indicated by the card held, that player is declared the winner immediately.

The game can be played by one family with the participants playing as individuals, or as a contest between families.

30362.description:
A contest got the designers of Mr. Jack 137 ideas for new characters. Out of those 137 two were chosen:

Steve McKeogh's “Spring-Heeled Man” who can jump over other people or obstacles
Arnaud Fillon's “Abberline”, an inspector




The expansion contains these 2 new characters and 3 others designed by Bruno Cathala and Ludovic Maublanc:

John Pizer, a butcher who frightens everyone
Joseph Lane, an anarchist who builds barricades
Madame, who can move fast, but won't enter the sewers




Furthermore, the expansion contains rules for a new way to set up the game.

Released: Essen 2007.

Expands:

Mr. Jack




Mr. Jack is exclusively published by Hurrican, all printings of Mr. Jack are from Hurrican and distributed by other companies
30362.name: Mr. Jack Extension

30363.description:
1001 Karawane is set in the desert. Players are in search of three magic artifacts - the winning condition of the game. The player who can 'read' the desert best, has the best chance at winning the game.

Water is of much importance as is protection for your caravans. In cities you'll find gold and gold you can trade with dealers - you might even trade it for a magical artifact.
30363.name: 1001 Karawane

30364.name: Those Pesky Garden Gnomes
30364.description:
Those Pesky Garden Gnomes is a non-partner trick-taking card game with a twist – in fact, possibly many twists!

The game uses four suits of different lengths, with cards containing positive and negative point values. While using standard trick-taking rules – with players needing to follow suit and the highest card in the suit taking the trick and giving the lead – each player in Those Pesky Garden Gnomes has a different goal in hand each round – and these change randomly with each new hand. Thus, a player knows only his goal and not those of the other players. A player's score for a hand is based on how close he comes to achieving his goal. The points a player scores are added to his running total, and players in a worse position in later rounds are given more options each round. After a set number of rounds, the player with the lowest score wins!

30365.name: The Great Chinese Railway Game
30365.description:
The Great Chinese Railway Game is a remake of Reiner Knizia's Stephenson's Rocket.

The game will have a completely new map - a map of China instead of England - and some rule changes.

Players are building railroads and try to gain influence as stockholders in 7 different train companies.

30366.name: Up the Creek; The Salmon Survival Game
30366.description: Each player represents one of six species of Pacific salmon in their actual round trip from the spawning grounds to ocean, & back again to British Columbia. Avoid extreme dangers, maintain health, or go extinct. Rules for a basic and advanced game.

boardgamehonor: 2008 International Gamers Award - General Strategy: Two-players
30367.description:
This game is set in the Perry Rhodan universe, a hugely popular German space-opera book series published since 1961. The term "kosmisch" means "cosmic"; "Hanse" refers to the Hanseatic League, a Medieval trade network in Northern Europe. In the american translation of the book series the phrase "Die Kosmische Hanse" was translated as "The Cosmic House".

In this game the players take on the roles of traders who transport goods between planets. Occasionally one can carry also passengers, which brings additional yields. Players can invest in cargo space, transmitters or faster drives to improve their spaceships.

Heinrich Glumpler, the designer of the game, is a fan of Merchant of Venus, as you can see from this comment.

The artwork is by Swen Papenbrock, one of the illustrators of the Perry Rhodan book series.

This game is part of the Kosmos two-player series.


Game Summary
Place the 6 planet cards in a line. The goods cards are double-sided; randomize them, then place several on each planet grouped by type (but no more than 2/type/planet to start). Players' ships start on planet 1. Each has their own deck, shuffled; draw 5 card hand. The cards are mostly tech cards, which can give you ongoing power; or single-use cards (counter opponent's card by playing matching card yourself). Spend VP to play the cards.

On your turn, move your ship (costs less energy moving towards sun), pick up stuff (start game with only 1 cargo hold), deliver stuff. When you deliver, you flip the delivered cards over; any resulting matches are removed from game -- works as a game timer! You win by getting to target (70) VP. If goods are gone first, most VP wins.
30367.name: Perry Rhodan: The Cosmic League
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 21 - Looking at the Designs of Antoine Bauza
Low Player Count - Ep 18 - The Pick Up & Deliver Episode
Low Player Count - Ep. 8 - Popular Mechanics
Spiele-Podcast Nr. 25: Perry Rhodan - Die Kosmische Hanse (Kosmos)

30368.name: "Struggle"...a game about life
30368.description:
Struggle is a game about life. Each player/team starts with $650. Every time you pass Payday on the board you earn $1,500. You can purchase things like Auto and Life Insurance and 'You're The Boss' cards, make investments and pay bills.

Once players pass Payday three times they will draw a 'Last Will' card which will give them a cash bonus or make them pay a cash penalty. The winning player/team with the most money after counting their cash and investments is the winner.

30369.name: Beat the Drum
30369.description:
Beat The Drum is a game for 'Salvationists' as stated on the front box. It is described as a fascinating trivia game for Ages 12 and up

Various questions in the categories of - Salvation Army, General Quiz, Old Testament, and New Testament are asked in levels of Easy, Hard and Master. By answering the Easy, Hard and Master, players advance their marker one, three or five steps respectively.

The winner is the one who reaches GLORY first.

30370.description:
In E.T.I., players become directors of powerful mega-corporations in the early 1960's with the goal of defending the Earth from a pending alien invasion!

Players compete to discover increasingly advanced technologies from eight different fields of science and technology. Completing projects increases the power and influence of your lab facility.

After a pre-determined number of technologies have been discovered, one of the players will reveal themselves as allied with the aliens! With this the invasion is near! The remaining humans labs must use their fantastic discoveries in Earth's final defense!

Will one of the human facilities have the strength to repel the aliens or will the Earth fall? It is in your hands...
30370.name: E.T.I.: Estimated Time to Invasion
boardgamepodcastepisode: Vox Republica 116: North Wind (Is Totally Not A Pirate Game)

30372.name: Mormon Baseball
30372.description:
This is a religious-themed trivia game for members of the Latter Day Saints (Mormon) church. The trivia questions are religious in nature and are asked and answered in a mechanism simulating a simple baseball game. The key to the game is the question and answer booklet, which includes two pages of rules and 53 pages of questions. Each page has six numbered questions and answers. There is a cardboard field inset in the box and plastic pegs to use as runners.

For each "at bat", the batting player rolls a D6. For the first batter, the "pitcher" on the opposing team reads that numbered question from page 1. If the player answers correctly, he receives the result designated for that question. If he answers incorrectly, he is out. Pegs are placed on the field and advanced accordingly. One roll on each page provides a result without a question.

With each succeeding batter, the question moves to the next page of the booklet, allowing a long game before any possibility of a repeated question arises. As per normal baseball rules, three outs ends an inning and the team with most runs scored after nine innings wins. The game seems to expect high scores: there are holes in the scoreboxes for 24 runs by each team.

Many of the questions are very basic: "Who was the real father of Jesus?" (God). Others require more detailed knowledge of the Mormon church: "Name the brother of Joseph Smith whose name begins with the letter H who was one of the Eight Witnesses" (Hyrum), or "Which of the following is not an office in the Melchizedek Priesthood: Elder, Seventy, Teacher, or High Priest?" (Teacher).

30373.name: Cues 'n Clues
30373.description: This is a religious-themed party game aimed at members of the LDS (Mormon) church. The game mechanics are similar to those used in the game show $20,000 Pyramid, and involves competition between teams to identify words on a list from clues given by a team member within a time limit.

30374.name: Fours
30374.description:
A simple game, played with 5 dice and similar in mechanics to Yahtzee, in which players get 3 chances to roll the lowest score possible.

At the beginning of each player's turn, they roll all 5 dice. Then, they may set aside any number of those dice and roll the remaining dice a second time. They may again set aside any number of dice and re-roll the remaining dice for a third time. Dice you set aside previously may be re-rolled if you wish, and you may end your turn at any time if you are happy with your current roll.

Once the rolling is done, your score is the total of all dice, with a few special rules:

1. Fours are free, so you do not add those to the total.
2. If you have four dice showing the same number (except four), you subtract that many from the total. Five dice of that number does not count.
3. If you roll a straight (all five dice in order sequentially), you subtract 4 from your total.

The game can be played with any number of people, and plays over five rounds, or however many you wish. At the end of the five rounds, the person with the lowest total wins.

30375.name: Make a Painting
30375.description:
From the rules: "There are 8 paintings in the game. Each painting consists of 12 cards.

"Version 1: The aim of the game is to collect cards to make a full painting or paintings.

"Version 2: The aim of the game is to collect pieces to make a painting by memorizing their position on the playing area."

Paintings are by van Brussel, Constable, van Eyck, van Gogh, Ingres, Renoir, Seurat, and Uccello.

30376.name: Powarvasion
30376.description:
From the box:

"In POWARVASION(tm), two warring players battle to capture the other's government or three major cities. Players alternate moving one of their armed forces pieces until the war is over. These fighting forces move and capture in any direction up to their maximum range. Strategy and skill are the keys to victory. Players set hidden defensive traps, carry out hit and run raids and multiple captures, set up formidable geographical barriers, and launch nuclear attacks. POWARVASION(tm) is easy to learn, fun to play, and a superior war game challenge!"

The board (with a sample setup, less the hidden traps and presumably cities) is shown on the back of the box. 9x9 square grid, Country Capital (white house), ICBM and Bomber (counters?) look like the King & Queen in chess, flanked by two sets of helicopter, artillery and jet pieces in the knight/bishop/rook configs. 3 tanks and 6 infantry round out the pawn row (tanks at ends and center). From the board, it looks as if the next two rows you can choose where to set your 3 mountains; single river, lake and forest pieces, as well as two minefields and a missile site, along with between 6-9 "hidden" pieces (one side has 6, the other 9).

The side of the box has a picture of Col. James Jacobson, USAF ret., with a recommendation: "Powarvasion ...is an easy game to play, a thinking man's game of unmatched realism!"

30378.name: Anyone Can Par
30378.description:
Anyone Can Par is a golf simulation game.

The general rules of golf are followed. Players tee-off by rolling up to 5 white dice. The dice are added up and the total is multiplied by 10 to determine the yardage. To simulate a hook or slice, the black die is rolled to determine which lane the ball lands in. Shots from sand traps, putts and chip shots are done with special dice that have non-standard number distributions:




Brown

Sand Trap Shot

1:2:3:3:3:4



Red

Chip Shot

1:2:2:3:3:4



Green

Putt

1:2:2:2:3:4






Alternately, these shots can be done by taking the appropriate card and following the instructions. As the player's marker (ball) gets closer to the green, they will wish to roll fewer white dice to ensure they do not overshoot the hole. Markers landing in hazards suffer penalties. The course includes 9 holes with water hazards, sand traps, out of bounds areas, and trees.

30379.description:
A racing game with a twist.

Players secretly get a horse (of a particular color) assigned before the game starts. The player with the horse in last place at the end of the game wins.

On your turn - sequence of play is decided by auction - you play a card that controls two different colored horese. When every player has put down cards, the horses move; but only horses with an odd number of cards on the table! If the number of open cards is even, the horse does not move.

But, true to the spirit of horse racing, each player has a chance to play a "dirty trick", including Change Horses. This can affect the game dramatically.

The best detailed description of the game is here.

{This is one of the few multiplayer games that plays equally well with only two}
30379.name: Change Horses

boardgamehonor: 2008 Deutscher Spiele Preis Best Family/Adult Game 3rd Place
2008 Golden Geek Best Board Game Artwork/Presentation Nominee
2008 Golden Geek Best Gamer's Board Game Nominee
2008 JoTa Best Heavy Board Game Nominee
2008 JoTa Best Heavy Board Game Winner
2008 Nederlandse Spellenprijs Nominee
2008 Nederlandse Spellenprijs Winner
30380.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Cuba prior to the revolution: Under turbulent circumstances, the villages of the island strive for independent wealth and influence. Who can buy and sell his products and goods on the domestic market profitably or take in the most on the trading ships? Who can send the right delegate to parliament in order to influence the government legislative process, or erect distilleries, hotels and banks at the right moment to the benefit of his village?

Whoever has accumulated the most victory points in Cuba by the end of the game wins. Players earn victory points by shipping merchandise from the harbor, but also by erecting and using buildings, and by abiding by the law.
boardgameversion: Dutch edition with Nederlandse Spellenprijs logo
30380.name: Cuba

boardgamehonor: 2008 Golden Geek Best Gamer's Board Game Nominee
2008 International Gamers Awards - General Strategy; Multi-player Nominee
2008 JoTa Best Heavy Board Game Nominee
30381.description:
Hamburg in the 17th century! Mighty walls protect the city against the devastations of the Thirty Years War. Thanks to Protestant refugees, Hamburg has become the biggest and most prosperous city in Germany. From far away, the skyline shows the steeples of huge churches and the masts of mighty trade ships displaying the citizens' pride and prosperity.

In Hamburgum, players guide the families of Hamburg in the pursuit of wealth and prestige. They produce beer, sugar, and cloth and ship these goods overseas. They compete over the best sites for their buildings and the best berths for their ships in the harbor. Ultimately, they vie for the most prestigious church donations, because neither gold nor goods but only prestige decides the final outcome.

Expanded by

Hamburgum: Lisboa
Hamburgum: Antverpia
30381.name: Hamburgum
boardgamepodcastepisode: 제105회 게임 대 게임 - 론델 시스템

30382.name: Rubik's Brain Game
30382.description:
Rubik's Brain Game is more or less a 2-dimensional Mastermind. As in that game, players take turns setting up a pattern which the other player must deduce, with the player making the deduction in the fewest moves winning the game.

In this game, a pattern is a 3x3 grid with each square being one of 6 colors, looking much like the side of a scrambled Rubik's Cube (the pattern is formed with 9 small cubes). On each turn, the guesser can either ask the setter if a given set of three colors are in a given row or column, or can ask if a given space is a specific color. In the former case the colors present and the colors not present are placed in different sections of the board for tracking purposes.

30383.name: Trivia Britannica
30383.description:
The object of Trivia Britannica is to get to London via the M25 motorway from wherever you started on the game board.

To reach London, you must have collected tokens from around the board. These are obtained by landing on token cities and answering a question from the category related to that city. On answering a question correctly, the active player can roll the dice and move again.

The standard game requires 3 tokens to get into London, the expert game requires 6.

Home Page: http://www.triviabritannica.com

30384.name: General Manager: The Baseball Business Game
30384.description:
General Manager - The Baseball Business Game produced in 1967 by the H & S Game Co, of
Columbia, S.C.

The box is plain green cardboard, with the title
in a yellow label sort of area that also touts
the game as "educational & realistic," "for 2
to 4 players" and notes "New players
may enter the game at any time."

The folded green playing board has a generally

Monopoly* sort of layout, with five franchises




per side (named only by city) taking the place
of *Monopoly* properties and the white "track"
interrupted by "Breaks of the Game" squares,
which also occupy each corner of the "track."
Each of the four sides of the "track" has a
semicircular "siding" featuring smaller squares
for "trades" and minor-league purchases. There
are cards for "player development" and lots of
phony cash. (More information to follow)

Game listing comes from a compilation of games created by:

Yahoo Group ---- Baseball Games Group;antique baseball games to modern tabletop sims

at the following site

http://members.aol.com/Butch7999/BbTitles.htm

More description of the game will be forthcoming from information received from members of the group.

30385.name: RoCo
30385.description:
RoCo was developed to answer a challenge, "You can't produce a race game that doesn't rely on dice". RoCo is a simple game for 2-4 players. If you can count you can play RoCo.

But can you win?

30386.name: Battle 3000: Come Defend Your Planet
30386.description:
Collectible Card Game where you aim to dispose of your planet's nuclear waste on another planet, while preventing aliens dumping their waste on yours. Attacks are made by constructing an elaborate pattern of cards on the table and then announcing an attack based on the total attack scores of all played cards.

Published only in Australia and no longer available.

30387.name: Wiggul
30387.description:
Wiggul your way through to capture or display!

Wiggul (also previously known as Squiggle) was conceived as an update for the game Kasam. It includes the escort capture style of Kasam but uses a hexagonal board. An additional aspect of the game is that winning can be by position (getting 5 pieces in a line).

30388.name: Xephyr
30388.description:
Xephyr is ideally designed for three players, but can be played with any number between 2 and 6. Balance and co-operation are the ways to win in Xephyr.

Xephyr uses a dice; the latter is unusual for Fleur Designs games but it doesn't mean the element of skill is missing. The whole game is based on your skill of balance; can you get your first piece to its goal whilst keeping your second under control? If you can't then you can lose badly.

30389.name: Diversion
30389.description: Diversion is a simple game in which your move dictates where your opponent can move. Do you go for speed or sending your opponent in circles?

30390.name: Qiddle
30390.description: Qiddle is a redesign of The Royal Game of Ur, with a design goal of adding meaning to the spaces while altering the layout of the spaces. It pits player against player against player against player. Two or four compete but there are limited safe spaces and your resources won't allow you to keep to safe havens.

30391.name: Five
30391.description: Five is derived from an ancient Indian game like Ludo. Unlike all other games from this source, Five can be played without dice; then it turns into a game of pure strategy.

30392.name: Guide
30392.description:
Guide is a game of tactics for two players and extends some of the gameplay of draughts (checkers). It is played with draughts pieces on a Laita board (irregular 4x5 diamond).

Instead of taking pieces from the board, as in draughts, captured pieces are stacked beneath the attacking piece and can be rescued later when their attacker in turn is captured.

30393.description:
QUAO is the absolute, supreme ruler of an unruly wasteland at the edge of civilization where attempts at democracy are futile. There is only one law in the land and that law is QUAO (pronounced ‘cow’). The mighty and all-powerful bovine of the badlands, QUAO governs the province by sheer antagonism. Only she knows the Rules and she hands them down with iron hoof.

WHAT’S UP WITH THE QUAO YOU ASK? First of all, she’s not just a cow, she’s a dictator and you better get used to playing by her Rules!

WHAT DOES IT MEAN TO BE QUAO? When you play this game, being QUAO means you know the Rules and everyone else has to figure them out. You also hand out all the penalties! Use your secret Rules and the help of your loyal subjects Quak, JaQuas and BullyQ to win this game. Just watch out for Cheata’, because she could be your downfall!

OBJECT: Each player is dealt five white cards. Each player has a chance to discard one card during each turn. The person that successfully completes and discards all the cards in their hand first, wins the round and becomes the dictator QUAO. Whoever wins the fifth and final round is the ultimate dictator and the winner!

HOW TO PLAY: There are four different ‘suits’ of white cards and each suit is played differently when discarded. During each turn a player may discard one of their cards from their hand to the table.
30393.name: Quao

30394.name: Gold Rush
30394.description:
Gold Rush is a game of alertness and fast reactions. The idea is to collect 5 identical cards and the grab a gold nugget.

This game comes with a board and specific places to put the gold nuggets. There are 62 cards with seven for each of the eight minerals (Gold, Diamond, Emerald, Silver, Platinum, Ruby, Copper and Iron). There are also six cards for Fool's Gold.

30395.name: Non Sequitur
30395.description:
Avoid reaching the 'Out' square (at the end of the board) by successfully giving answers that are within chosen categories.

Ex- If a category is 'State Capitals' each player must name a state capital in a clockwise rotation until a player cannot think of an answer or duplicates an answer already given.

The winner is the player closest to start when a player reaches the 'Out' square.

30396.name: Odds And Evens
30396.description:
Odds and Evens is a gas rationing board game that was created in 1979 at the height of the gasoline crisis.

Game components include 'Odds' and 'Evens' cards which aid you in moving around the board and collecting 'Ration Coupons', 'Gas Cards' and 'Credit Cards'.

30397.name: Cranium Squawkbox: Lunch Munch
30397.description:
It's time to eat! Lindy the Lunch Lady is cooking up all sorts of fun in her kitchen … like anchovy milkshakes and mashed potato pizza! Her wild menu is sure to have you giggling as you match cards together to create four-course meals. Once you've collected a five-meal feast for Lindy's cafeteria, you win!

Lunch Munch is portable, easy to play, and features an electronic Lunch Lady announcer for a card game unlike any you've played before.

What's in the box?
Includes electronic Squawkbox and 88 illustrated Lunch Munch cards. Requires three AAA batteries (included).

30398.name: Hockeypoker
30398.description: From the box: "Hockeypoker will fascinate the whole family, make up your teams, play cards on ice and score! Beware of the face-off! Outplay your opponents with strategy and speed! Move the puck to your advantage by playing your hand of offensive and defensive players, goalies and star players". Contents include gameboard, instructions, a deck of cards and five "pucks".

30399.description:
White Eagles is a 64-page book supplement to the Panzer Grenadier series, focused on the battles of September 1939, between Poland's defenders and the German and Soviet invaders. There are 40 new scenarios depicting both sides on the attack, battles of cavalry against cavalry, and even a tank battle or two. Plus of course background articles on the armies and weapons involved. This module is not playable by itself, but requires ownership of Eastern Front and Road to Berlin to enjoy all of the scenarios. White Eagles includes 165 die-cut and mounted playing pieces. Almost all of them represent Polish forces: tanks, cavalry, armored cars, infantry, machine gun, mortar, anti-tank, artillery and of course leaders. The book's format is the same as our very popular Sinister Forces and Fronte Russo books.

This game is part of the Panzer Grenadier series

Expands:

Panzer Grenadier: The East Front




Expanded by:

Panzer Grenadier: First Axis
30399.name: Panzer Grenadier: White Eagles
boardgameexpansion: Panzer Grenadier: Campaigns and Commanders Vol 1 – War in the East
Panzer Grenadier: Hopeless, But Not Serious
Panzer Grenadier: Battle of the Bulge

30400.name: Scramble for Africa
30400.description:
You try to conquer the most valuable African countries. If you want to attack another player you have to declare war on him first, allowing him to attack you first. Also, there can be only 4 people at war at the same time; the fifth declaration of war ends the oldest conflict.

It's very homemade, including the self-drawn components.

30402.name: SuperSystem 2007 Annual
30402.description:
From the web-site:

"The SuperSystem 2007 Annual has arrived! Taking a cue from the long tradition of Summer annual issues in comic books, Four-Color Figures presents the SuperSystem 2007 Annual. This supplement for the SuperSystem miniature battle-game offers new characters, powers, and scenarios for added table-top comic book mayhem! Also included is a Fast-Play sheet summarizing the core rules, and with a bit of help from a grizzled veteran, providing enough guidance for a newcomer to try the game."

Expands:

SuperSystem (second edition)




This Print-n-Play game can be found at:
http://www.wargamedownloads.com/item.php?item=569

30403.name: Oil Barons
30403.description:
Oil Barons is a board game based on buying and selling in the oil industry.

On a player's turn, the player rolls 2d6, with doubles giving you extra turns. When you land on a square you get options to change your position on the board, such as buying/selling oil wells or opening/closing oil pipelines.

The winner is the first player to deliver a specified number of oil barrels to the Refinery, usually 15 or 25.

Contents of box:-
Playing Board
Rules
2 d6 dice
24 Bank Cards [similar to Monopoly chance cards]
1 pad of 50 Scorecards
225 Bank notes [6 different denominations, 5,000, 10,000, 20,000, 50,000, 100,000, 500,000]
8 White Discs marked OFF on one side, blank on the other
6 Hats [white green black yellow red blue]
18 grey Oil Rigs
72 Barrels [12 of each colour - white green black yellow red blue]
72 Flags [12 of each colour - white green black yellow red blue]

30404.name: The M25
30404.description:
The M25 is a light party-ish game revolving around the circular M25 Motorway. On their turn, players pick up a card and do what it says - anything from a simple move to a full-blown charade, with drawings and lip reading possibilities.
